Reviews.Title: “THE place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: AnthonynPegC
Reviews.Content: In taking our first trip to Rome, we had some concerns about where to stay, language barriers, and safety. We chose to stay at The Hotel San Carlo and not only were we pleased, we were thrilled! The staff at Hotel San Carlo could not have done anything else to make our stay more wonderful. The hotel is lovely, located in the best area for sightseeing and shopping. We walked all over Rome touring the city the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, Pantheon, Coliseum, Roman Forum, even a stroll back from Vatican City. Victoria was so kind and helpful she recommended restaurants, even translated a conversation with Italian relatives that came by to visit. Alberto anticipated our every need he made reservations for us and made sure our taxi's were there on time, Rosanna helped us with directions to sights and tours. They never made us feel like a bother, though we had lots of questions. We looked forward to a breakfast of croissants, rolls, cheese, fresh fruits, cereals and delicious cappuccino served with a smile to start the day by Antonella , Marina, and Lina on the beautiful rooftop garden. We stayed 5 days, left for 4 and when we returned Dante carried our bags to our room which was upgraded to a larger room with a lovely balcony, just beautiful! Everyone made us feel so welcome, like honored guests. We cannot wait to go back one day. We would recommend this as THE place to stay in Rome, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel In Rome”
Reviews.Author: Malabowabo
Reviews.Content: Was very pleased with the room and staff. The location is within walking distance of nearly all of the sites and attractions of Rome. Would stay there again. Loved the room with the loft!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: Polina P
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels in Rome. We travel frequently in Rome , so we have tried different hotels, but this is in our opinion the most successful. Excellent match between quality and price. The hotel is within walking distance of all major attractions. As you know Rome is very lively and bustling city so also one of the advantage is that the hotel is located on a quiet little street, which allows you to sleep without the noise. The main plus is the hotel's helpful personnel which is always ready to help with everything you need. Clean comfortable rooms and nice breakfast on the veranda, what else is needed.

Reviews.Title: “Not the place to stay!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: pat h
Reviews.Content: I booked online a superior double. Before booking, I called & spoke w Vittoria.Told her I was a smoker, & wanted a room with a terrace. She suggested that instead I should ask for a renovated room, & could use the roof top to smoke. I went with her suggestion & wrote all of this in my reservation request.The week previous to our arrival, we were in Rome for the day.We went to the hotel & again reiterated our request, & were told it was not a problem The day of our arrival, I again made my request clear. We were given a room that was in no way a superior room. It was not a renovated room or one with a terrace. The man at the desk said this was all that was available. The bathroom was so small that if we had any girth, we would not have fit between the sink & the tub. We understand the size of rooms in the center of Rome, as my husband is Italian, & we divide out time between the US & Italy. DO NOT recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kristina S
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a very good location,- near spanish stairs. The accomodation is perferct - very clean, smells wonderfull and the personell is very helpfull. But the main influence on my opinion about hotel, made a Hude terrase of the hotel. From the terrase opens the view of Roma architecture. In the terrase you feel like you really take from your life the best thigs!!!!

Reviews.Title: “It keeps getting better!”
Reviews.Author: luvroma2
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the San Carlo numerous times. They continue to upgrade the rooms and the hotel in general. In November, they moved the breakfast room from the ground floor to the roof top garden area. They have also expanded the breakfast options to include freshly baked croissants and apple croissants, as well as fresh fruit, lunch meat and cheese. The terrace is enclosed in plastic flaps and there are portable heaters which makes it very comfortable. It is a pleasant way to start the day. The staff is always the same - no turnover - which I think is a good thing. They are all pleasant and accommodating. The rooms are very clean, as are the common areas. There is free Internet access - a big plus. The location of this hotel is excellent - 2 blocks from the Spanish steps where there is a Metro stop and a line of taxis. If you are reasonably fit, you can walk to many of the major sightseeing areas. There are numerous very good restauarants nearby - plus via Condotti - one of the most exclusive shopping streets in the world - is one block away. Considering everything this hotel has to offer, I think it is an incredible bargain and I would recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “" The place to stay "”
Reviews.Author: MelvinU
Reviews.Content: This was my 6th time staying at Hotel San Carlo . My visit to Rome was for 3 weeks from the middle of November up to Dec 7 . It is a very nice and clean hotel with an excellent location , right in the middle of many sights . The management and staff were very helpful and most delightful . The breakfast was more than ample and served on the roof terrace which was a new location and very pleasant . Definitely the place to stay while in Rome !

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for Central Rome”
Reviews.Author: NotRealHoosiers
Reviews.Content: For anyone familiar or new to Rome, you know the hotels in the Eternal City can be the most expensive on your trip to Italy. We found this small hotel several years ago and have stayed there a number of times, now. It is perfectly located a block from Via del Corso and all the great places to walk within the city. There are lots of restaruants and cafe/bars in the area and they are not overrun by tourists, so you can enjoy some real Roman ambiance. The rooms are comfortable and clean, the bathrooms typical for older Roman hotels. The breakfast is typical, too, but a pleasant way to start the day. The staff is wonderful - helpful in directions, finding restaurants, and arranging transportation to the airport at ungodly hours. For location, this is a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value With One Flaw”
Reviews.Author: thadzer
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel if you are not a large person. It is perfectly located on a small alley just two blocks from the Spanish Steps, the staff is friendly and recommended some fabulous restaurants, the included continental breakfast is fresh and tasty, our room was quiet, clean and comfortable with a great bed. However our room had the world's smallest shower stall. I'm a pretty big guy at 6'1" & 240 pounds, and taking a shower was a major challenge because it was virtually impossible to move in the enclosure. We would definitely stay here again BUT only if we were able to get a larger shower.

Reviews.Title: “It's all about location”
Reviews.Author: ppiieeff
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a lovely little street, surrounded by the same, close to the Spanish Steps and amazing shops, close to the Big Bus bus stop. The crowds are mainly around the Steps which creates a great atmosphere and a good place to eat an icecream. The restaurants around the hotel in all the little streets, were the best we encountered throughout Rome. The room was basic, but had all we needed, a small fridge, t.v., somewhere to put your luggage, and the bathroom was newly renovated, small, but everything worked. Breakfast was on the rooftop, ample and basic, but absolutely fine for a place to crash after a busy discovery day in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: K F
Reviews.Content: Hotel San Carlo was recommended to us by Italian friends and we would highly recommend - one Italian likened it to staying in the Kensington area of London. Helpful staff, lovely rooms, safe, small fridge, wardrobes, drawers and ensuite, clean and ample, especially as it's only for sleeping in; our trip was to see Rome and see and enjoy it we did! Breakfast on the roof terrace and then spend the day exploring. The Hotel is minutes from the Metro so when we arrived at Ciampino airport, we took a bus (4 Euros) to Anagnina, then the Metro to Spagna (1 Euro) and it was a 2 minute walk to the hotel. We did book a taxi via the hotel for the return trip so we would be at the airport on time (30 Euros set price). The Hotel even gave us the drivers details incase we left anything in the taxi or had any problems. The Spanish Steps and the upmarket shops of Versace, Prada and Gucci are round the corner from the hotel if that's what you want. Staff directed us to restaurants and shops - not the tourist ones, with high prices and frozen meals, but the ones where they themselves would eat and shop. Try out NINOS restaurant nearby which was recommended by the Hotel and we had one of the nicest meals of our stay. We bought a bottle of wine in one of the local shops one day and the hotel happily lent us a bottle opener so we could drink it in the room. We walked everywhere and enjoyed Rome. I would return to the Hotel in the future and recommend it to friends and family and anyone who wants to have a fantastic time in a beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding location, very nice hotel with clean accomodations”
Reviews.Author: Bakers_10
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in Rome at the San Carlo last Fall. It is in an outstanding location in the city, 3 minutes walk to the Spanish Steps and two minutes to Via del Corso. Great restaurants, shopping and site seeing surrounds you. The subway is only 4 minutes walk from the hotel. Service is solid if unremarkable, but the staff are pleasant. Rooms were spacious by European standards, and most importantly, very clean and well kept. Rates were very reasonable given the location and how expensive many hotels are in Rome. Overall, excellent choice for travellers who are not seeking a "chain" hotel experience and want to enjoy a more European experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but negotiate!”
Reviews.Author: BAR07
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 10 weeks between June and September, I was checking in every Monday, out every Thursday, so I think I have enough experience to state my opinion. Very central location, good sized double-rooms, friendly staff. Insist on staying in the 700 rooms; 701, 702 etc, those are the best. Avoid the annex, although the rooms are larger, they are much noisy and outdated. Negotiate and you will get great value for money in this hotel. Just opposite the hotel, there's a restaurant, I've been there once, only because there was very heavy rain on one day in July, I would not recommend that restaurant to anyone. My recommendation for restaurants are: Maccheroni, piccolo arancio, cantina e cucina. At Fiumicino airport, take a taxi to central Rome. Be careful though because while Rome-based taxis charge fixed rate of EUR40, Fiumicino-based taxis charge fixed rate of EUR60. So ask before you get in, and prefer a Rome taxi! Enjoy Rome and San Carlo!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Eszter W
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel San Carlo for three nights in September and had the best experience. A very charming hotel owned by the nicest family. Our room was large and very comfortable; the bathroom was beautiful and very clean. The location is to die for – every famous tourist attraction is in walking distance. There are plenty of restaurants and shops nearby and the hotel is about a minute from the Spanish steps. I have to mention how great this hotel treated us at the end. We left our iPad and an Amazon Kindle in the room – which was totally our fault. After emailing the hotel and sending over the necessary shipping documents they returned them promptly to the US. We are very thankful for their kindness and we will recommend this hotel to everyone who travels to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “"Friendly staff, excellent location"”
Reviews.Author: brazilian_tourist
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights in this hotel in september, during a 20-day vacation with my family. Location is perfect. A few steps from Piazza di Spagna and walking distance to major attractions in Rome. Staff is extremely friendly and helpful. Hotel seems to be under renovation. Some rooms need urgent repair (the one i stayed, for instance). My mother stayed in a renovated room, wich was much better. Breakfast is served on the rooftop and exceeded our expectations. Overall, it is a good 2-star hotel (not a 3-star hotel, as advertised). If you are looking for a place to have a good night of sleep and don´t bother for design and luxury, this is the perfect place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely to be back at San Carlo”
Reviews.Author: Justraveling
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at San Carlo - the first time round, my family had the quadruple room, this time I used a single. Small room, especially the bathroom, but very clean and a good breakfast on the roof top terrace. The staff are very helpful and welcoming, they make you feel like an old friend. San Carlo is perfectly placed for many of Rome's best sights, within walking distance of most. Great to stroll along Via del Corso in the evening, just people watching. I felt extremely safe at all times and though I took the precaution of using a money belt, never felt anxious or concerned being on my own. Vatican Transfers are very reliable, Piotr Bogdan is the owner, the driver was waiting exactly where he said he would be at the airportc and departure was as easy. Contact : www.vatican-transfer.com, they are recommended by the hotel. I can't wait for my next visit and would not think of using any other hotel - for the price and location, San Carlo cannot be bettered.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Fabolous location”
Reviews.Author: Rasa L
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at this hotel and can say that the room was excellent, very clean and comfortable bed. The room was kept clean throughout all our stay. The best thing about this hotel it's great location and the breakfast on the roof terrace. When we booked a room we didn't know that they serve breakfast on the terrace (we were very surprised of the quality of the breakfast). The service was exellent. For the next trip to Rome I will choose this hotel for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: olga p
Reviews.Content: Thank You for rending our stay so pleasant. We spent 3 nights at the San Carlo Hotel at the benggining of September, 2011 Everything was great starting from the reception (really very quick check-in), relaxing breakfast on the terrace in the morning and the room. We had a very good stay and highly recommend this hotel also for his excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent location, very nice, clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: Grazina G
Reviews.Content: And very friendly and helpfull staf. Labas, linkejimai nuo Deivido ir Grazinos.

Reviews.Title: “great location, very comfortable...”
Reviews.Author: arv4
Reviews.Content: we visited Rome in Aug 2011 - stayed here for 4 nights - great location, very walkable to metro by the Spanish Steps, the shopping area, the Piazza del Popolo/Borghese Garden, and the Lazio are is not far either. Clean, well appointed (air conditioned!) rooms, and a nice continental breakfast. The people at the desk are very helpful, and we got some nice recommendations for dining. We'd stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Second Stay and Better Than Ever”
Reviews.Author: elnap29
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Hotel San Carlo in 2006 and dedided to stay there again May 2011 for 4 nights. We asked for, and were given, a room on a higher floor (4th piano). We were prepared for lots of steps but were delighted to find that Hotel San Carlo had since installed an elevator! Our room was extremely clean with comfortable bed, good pillows, and modern bathroom. This time there was an in-room safe which was a big improvement over their previous system. The staff was helpful and friendly enough. We did have a momentary power outage that caused a problem with retrieving something from the safe. We called the front desk and someone came up to help us solve the problem immediately. Breakfast was OK, just some croissants, yogurts, juice, etc, but the cappuccino was heavenly - and served by friendly, cheerful staff. The location was perfect for us; we walked everywhere including to the Forum, Colosseo, the Vatican, and Trastevere. We'd definitely continue to recommend Hotel San Carlo to other travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: DomCanada
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay in Rome! Pros: - awesome location near Spanish steps on a cute side street (I've been to Rome twice now and I believe that Spanish steps is the best area to stay to explore the city: close to Metro that will take you to Vatican and Colloseum and walking distance to Trevi and pantheon) - good wifi - quiet rooms with very thick windows Cons: - breakfast is just so so Overall I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: raddison
Reviews.Content: Top Location, try and stay in annexx across the road., walking distance to Spanish Steps and Restaraunts. Staff friendly and speak English. Rooms well priced, value for money considering location. Clean and well presented.

Reviews.Title: “great spot in the main area of rome~”
Reviews.Author: navawritz
Reviews.Content: its a small Italian rome hotel. located right in the center of via del coroso area. the stuff are mostly friendly. but one guy that just did not seem to enjoy his job or his guests. the wifi worked great which is a good point in rome. the breakfast was really nice. and the coffee was real italian. the rooms are small but a/c is working fully unlike my other hotel in rome. safe area for girls alone. i will come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Supersphere67
Reviews.Content: My husband and I found this hotel on Rome Insiders Guide App and then checked it out on tripadvisor. It was right off the Spanish Steps in a small alley in a 17th century building. There is a breakfast every morning and the rooms are clean and air conditioned. We stayed in the annex around the corner- three floors and six rooms. It made the Roman adventure even more real for us. We walked everywhere because of the location, yet the bus and metro are within a 3-5 minute walk. There are small trattorias located all around in the quaint adjacent alley's which made this stay seem like something out of a movie! For breakfast there was cold cereal, and several different types of pastry and breads, fruit, juice, coffee tea and milk. The cost of the room, location and breakfast are truly a value in Rome. We will definitely return to Hotel San Carlo when we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: NikkiandAaron
Reviews.Content: Bare bones, but you get what you pay for in Rome. This is a fantastic location, just off the spanish steps and the room was clean and the room was a decent size. Everything in the room was funtional and they had a nice terrace to sit outside and drink wine. No thrills but a very safe bet if you are saving money but dont want to sacrifice cleanliness or location.

Reviews.Title: “Second time there and would go back again.”
Reviews.Author: sep23
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the second time and it was just the first. Great service and friendly staff. Breakfast staff were also very nice and they had a good spread of food though the croissants could have been better. We had the "camera matrimoniale standard" and it was big enough for two people. The shower was a little tight and I'm not a big guy. Plenty of hot water with a good pressure. We were on the second floor and was able to access the lobby wifi in the room which was nice. A/C worked well. The bed was a little short compared to even full size American beds. Location can't be beat. Walking distance to everywhere though the Coliseum is a bit of a hike. Tons of shopping and food around the area. The surroundings can get a bit noisy but we were on a lower floor.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful Rome hotel”
Reviews.Author: hotelsnob4u
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel San Carlo for 5 nights in August. With over 1200 hotels reviewed on Tripadvisor, I was very confused and nervous about choosing a hotel. This was our first time to Rome and I wanted a great hotel with great character in a good location for a great price. We were very pleased with our choice. I made our reservation directly with the hotel as I was requesting a travel agent discount. Victoria was very kind, prompt and helpful with emailing me the information, reservation and confirmation. We made our reservation very last minute and did not have time to convert our dollars into euros. When we arrived at the airport we went to the exchange counter only to find a horrific exchange rate (once all fees were added in, it would have been about 36.00 Euro for 100.00 us dollars). We thought we would get a better exhange at the hotel so we left the airport with our driver that was waiting for us with a sign with our name on it, arranged by Victoria ( for 50 euros) without Euro. Needless to say, the hotel did not exchange money but they were so helpful, they paid the driver and put the cab ride on our hotel bill. We were so relieved, they were like an extended family waiting for us. Check in was quick and efficient. Victoria spoke English and answered all our questions including directing us to a bank where we could exchange our money. The exchange places around the city were expensive to change money (except for the cambio at the Termani station) and most banks would not change at all. Once again Victoria was very informative and pointed us in the right direction. The porter was very efficient, he brought our bags to the room and always had a smile whenever we saw him. The room was on the small side but very clean and comfortable. My next visit I would get a superior room instead for about an extra 20 euro a night for a little extra space, quality and maybe a terrace. Never the less, the room was comfortable enough for us, a decent size bathroom, comfortable double bed, desk, tv, table and 2 chairs and a window that overlooked the street of lovely cafes and shops. We had plenty of closet space for our cloths and the ac worked really well which we really appreciated in the warm Rome August heat (about 88 degrees and sunny every day). The breakfast was ok, I am not a big breakfast eater but they had cereal, great breads and cookies, yogurt, juice and the best capaccino and espresso ever. The girls who served the breakfast and coffee were so sweet and pleasant. They did not speak English and I did not speak much Italian but we conversed without any problems, they seemed to know exatley what we wanted. The afternoon desk associate Rosanna was also so very sweet. She gave us the best restaurant suggestions. Edy and Da Fransescos were totally awesome. Since we always had to leave our room key with the desk, she always had a kind word and smile for us and was always spot on with reccomendations. The night desk associate was so cute and sweet. He always remembered our room number to give us our key and always had a smile and a "good night" to us. A good way to end the day. The location was the best. In an upscale, safe area right by the Spanish Steps and the main shopping street. We walked to the Vatican, Piazza Navona, Pantheon and, Trevi Fountain in a short amount of time. We bought a 48 hour pass on one of the double decker tour buses and took that to the Colosseum and the Forum. We did the whole tour on the bus and after seeing all of Rome and some of the other hotels we considered, we were so happy with the Hotel San Carlo and its location and our choice. After a full day of sightseeing in the heat, we always stopped at a little deli one block from the hotel for a bottle of wine, some sodas (I loved the orange Fanta), bottled water, olives, cheese and bread (all for about 12 Euro) and went back to our cool air conditioned room for a rest and a little happy hour before we refreshed and got ready to go out for the evenning. The hotel has a nice rooftop patio but it was not being used for the summer. Check out was quick and efficient, they pre-arranged a car to take us back to the airport (for 40 Euro and this time we actually had the Euro to give the driver) This is not the Ritz or the Marriott and I actually am glad I did not choose such a chain as I felt very absorbed in the romance and culture of Rome with our quaint location and accomodations at the San Carlo. The staff were all great and like a family and really looked after us. It was safe and clean and just perfect. I will definately use this hotel for my clients. Thanks you to all the great staff and I hope my coins tossed in the the Trevi Fountain bring be back to wonderful Rome and the Hotel San Carlo very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good value”
Reviews.Author: 2011_Travel_Destiny
Reviews.Content: For the location the hotel was reasonably priced (for Rome), I paid 165 dollars for a single. While the room was small it is more than adequate. Now the shower is a different story, if you are height-weight challenged you may have problems with the width of the shower. I am 5ft., 8in. at 165lbs and had no problems. Everything in the room was spotless as well as the lobby and breakfast area. The breakfast was nothing to write home about: coffee, rolls, breads, cheese, juice, cereal. The hotel has a free internet computer in the lobby, which ran slow for my standards, but got the job done. The location was perfect only three short blocks from the metro. Metro stop Spagna (Spanish Steps). Restaurants are within walking distance. Many upscale clothing shops are located in the area. I felt safe walking the area at night. One last thing, the staff was very helpful, helping me retrieve my lost luggage ensuring it was delivered from the airport to my room.

Reviews.Title: “Did you get my previous message?”
Reviews.Author: ricmar55
Reviews.Content: Dear Sir I`ve just spent a long time writing a review about the Hotel San Carlo in Rome on Via Delle Carrozze. Please let me know if it was recieved At the top of the page it said wrong hotel, I did not understand what it meant. I hate to think I spent all this time for nothing and you won`t get the message. We adored the hotel! I filled it out right before this one and need to know if you received the first one. Sincerely, Marcia Emch

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Rome and reasonable to boot!”
Reviews.Author: SusanfromHollis
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel via this site - was very happy with the location! Literally within a few hundred steps of the Spanish steps, it is surrounded by many small cafes, restaurants, and in the middle of the main shopping district as well. We walked to all of the major sites with no problem. Rome had a heat wave and we really appreciated the wonderful air conditioning in the room as well. Breakfast was very basic but they made great coffee to order. We had a triple and a double room that was in an annex around the the corner from the main hotel. Both rooms were very large and comfortable. Wifi was only available in the lobby, but free there and they had nice couches to relax on. We enjoyed our visit to Rome despite the heat, and this hotel was a nice oasis!

Reviews.Title: “The most charming and awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: Calypsowine
Reviews.Content: I had a fabulous time in Rome, and a very safe and comfortable experience at Hotel San Carlo. The staff was sweet, and answered all my questions with accuracy. I loved being so close to shopping and other historic attractions that I could walk to or take the conveniently located train. The hotel location is also perfect, tucked away on narrow Via Delle Carrozze for privacy but accessible to Rome's splendor. Definitely worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: SueS48
Reviews.Content: Super great location. Lovely staff, friendly and helpful. We felt at home. Good breakfast with the room considering this is Italy where breakfast can cost $10-$20 euros!! We could always find our way back here as it is so close to the Spanish Steps and could walk close to home and see tons of interesting things. Always something happening in the neighborhood. Lots of great places to eat and great window shopping only blocks away. Tucked away, quiet, clean and homey. It was our favorite place of our 3 weeks in Italy. We stayed 6 days and loved it! 420

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for families with young children”
Reviews.Author: SuzySethB
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a five-day stay at the wonderful Hotel San Carlo. I have never written a review for a hotel, but as we were leaving the hotel, I told my husband that I absolutely had to share this terrific little gem with other people, especially those traveling with a baby, as we did. As all the other reviews mention, the location is phenomenal. It is steps away from The Spanish Steps and just a short distance from Trevi Fountain, Piazza Navona, Villa Borghese, and dozens of other fabulous sites. Before we left for the trip, we were worried about how we would get to the things we wanted to see in Rome because we didn't want to haul our carseat around in cabs and we felt reluctant about having our two year-old ride in a taxi without a carseat. But luckily, we only had to take a cab from the airport because we were able to walk (with baby in stroller) EVERYWHERE we wanted. And we are not ordinarily big walkers. But Rome just inspires you to walk and because Hotel San Carlo is so centrally located, you never have to walk all that far. In addition to its incredible proximity to everything, the hotel rooms are perfect for those traveling with babies/toddlers. We were able to get a room with a terrace (our room was on the 4th floor) and so it was easy to put our daughter down for nap while we lounged on the terrace. Prior to the trip, we were concerned that we would have to just sit in a dark room everyday while she napped, but the terrace turned out to be a life saver! We could just close the doors of our terrace (keeping them ajar so we could hear her when she woke up) while she slept comfortably in the crib (provided by the hotel) in the dark room. The terrace was filled with pretty flowers and was lovely for reading books and mapping out the next day's itinerary. Just perfect! Finally, the proprietors at the hotel were incredibly helpful, spoke perfect English and were so friendly to our daughter, especially the sweet lady who manages the front desk in the evenings. She was so loving to our little girl and even gave her a little magic wand at the end of our stay, which of course our daughter adored. Anyway, I wanted to write this review because when I was searching for a hotel in Rome, it was hard to find one that I knew would be good for a young child, so I'm hoping this review points others with small children to this wonderful hotel, which honestly could not have been more ideal (or reasonably priced, given the location). Enjoy your trip to Rome -- this vacation was the best thing we we've ever done for our daughter, or for ourselves!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kimmo66
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during easter time...the location is fantastico, right by Spagna and shopping street Via Corso. Many quality shops and restaurants in the same area. Breakfast is very good and please use the beautiful terrace to enjoy your great start for the day!!!! Professional staff will help you with any requests in such a kindly way we have never experienced before.... Pick up service from and to the apt highly recommended...please ask for Kordas!! Takes around 40 min. Would like to recommend this Hotel to all. Special thanks to Victoria. By the way, she likes white roses!!! Crazie mille!!! We will defenately be back here! Easy now, do not have to put extra time to find an excellent hotel in Rome!!

Reviews.Title: “Location could not be better, staff warmer”
Reviews.Author: LisaMoscow_Russia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this nice hotel for our second time for 10 days at winter vacations. First time this hotel was recommended to us by my friend who is fan of Rome and Italy. We were very happy to stay here 2 years ago. This time we took our younger daughter of 15 who also was charmed by the hotel, not to say by Rome. We had a priviledge of having our own terrace (room 43) with splendind view on San Ambrogio and Carlo Dome with causy table and chairs where we could take lunches and some wine. The air, sleeping conditions and cleaning were of best quality. Coffee at the breakfast superb! We also love the staff who is not only spleaking English, but Russian too. We recommend this hotel to people who want to feel comfortable and truly Roman for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: dalehhi
Reviews.Content: I have visited Rome at least 12 times in last 7 years and always stay at this little jewel found in Piazza di Spagne. Nothing fancy just clean, nice, comfortable hotel. I would not even consider staying anywhere else!! The staff speaks English which helps as needed for directions, restaurant recommendations, etc. Great location. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “well worth it”
Reviews.Author: AJC_Chicago
Reviews.Content: bottomless capuccino and espressos in the morning, what more can i ask. room 78 on the fourth floor is one of the good ones because it is adjacent to a veranda. hotel is near shops, restaurants and the metro. about 1 mile to 2 miles to everything else - Trevi Fountain, Colloseum, Roman Forum, Pantheon, Piazza Navona and Vatican. So you can either take the metro or walk

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful the 2nd time around”
Reviews.Author: Ayerman38
Reviews.Content: The San Carlo is quite near the Spanish Steps, hence a great location for walking around Rome. Our annex room was very large, with a king bed and amples storage. The double-glazed windows and steel shutters assured us of quite sleep. As before, we encountered several other Californians staying there, although I am not sure how others found it. Staff were all very helpful - especially Victoria at the front desk, and Dante, who remembered us from our first visit a few years ago and was always there to help. When we departed, Victoria arranged a private car to get us to Civatevecchia to board our cruise ship at a much better price than I had seen quoted online, assuring us an easy, comfortable transfer. We would happily stay at the San Carlo again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great service, comfortable, highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: kkd78
Reviews.Content: As it was my first time in Rome, I wanted a nice location, good services, without breaking the bank. I picked Hotel San Carlo from a web site after reading reviews, and I'm so glad I did. Location is wonderful - quiet street a couple of blocks from Spanish Steps. Restaurants all around, easy walking to entire old city of Rome, easy walk to Metro. Hotel was clean and nice, and they have an english speaking person available 24 hours a day. Service was fantastic - recommendations for meals, directions, transportation, anything. They made my stay easy and nice, and I'd go back again in a heartbeat. Wifi a little iffy sometimes, but otherwise great.

Reviews.Title: “Great combo of value and location”
Reviews.Author: Wikkidnik
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband for 3 nights. It was just a short walk from the metro stop (spanish steps) and a great central location for site seeing. We enjoyed the rooftop terrace for drinking wine in the afternoons before dinner. This is not a fancy hotel- but for us it was perfect. The rooms were clean and the staff was friendly and it did not break the bank. I will not look for another hotel next time I visit Rome. For me it was the perfect combo of location, price and cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Your Ideal Stay In Rome”
Reviews.Author: Bella_Dina
Reviews.Content: This is my second time visiting Italy, I was all in love with Rome from the first visit, but I have to admit that one of the main reasons that made me enjoy my stay, is the awesome Hotel the one and only San Carlo, first of all, the location is absolutely magnificent, you are connected to the heart of Rome, you can reach any where just in two minutes walking... right at the end of the street is the Spanish Steps, can you imagine how this Hotel makes your stay just easy!! You don’t have to worry about how to reach any place; the Hotel’s location is just remarkable. Second, you are welcomed with a very customer oriented team, specially the beloved Rosanna, she is extremely helpful and always smiling, actually all the team is excellent and understanding, they also speak multiple languages specifically GOOD English so you don’t have to hurdle to deliver a message. Third, the rooms are very clean and neat, user friendly and modernized and I have to say that they offer very good rates compared to other Hotels who don’t enjoy such a unique location. Eventually Hotel San Carlo is not just a perfect Hotel in Rome, but I regard it as one of the most convenient Hotels I’ve ever been to. I’d definitely recommend the Hotel to all my friends and already my mother (Shahira) is a regular customer, she visits Italy annually for business purposes… I am a huge fan of San Carlo Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location- great room-fair service”
Reviews.Author: Titulina
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the San Carlo for four days last week. I went with my husband and my two kids - a 2 year old boy and a 10 month old baby girl- and we loved the hotel. The room was perfect as it had a king bed plus a crib and then a separate little room attached! that was a great surprise. What I loved the most was the location. It is absolutely PERFECT. A block from Spanish steps, the metro stations, the best gelato I had in Italy, etc. Also, if you have babies, the hotel is great because it is super QUIET. Everything is quiet, even the beds don't make one noise! Funny to make that comment but if you are sharing a room with little kids you know that you don't want to wake them up just because you turn around! The staff was just OK, not very knowledgeable or helpful. We paid 210 for our room and I think it was fair. The breakfast was not amazing but it included some fruit, yogurts, croissants, breads, etc ... ah! and some little pastries that were individually wrapped so we took some with us every day we were there :o) Anyway, I liked it a lot!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but lacking in everything else”
Reviews.Author: GalTraveler44
Reviews.Content: First off, don't come here if you need to do ANY sort of business while you are traveling. They advertise internet, but it basically only works if you are willing to wait 20 minutes for every webpage that you try to open. I had some work e-mails I had to return, and it made things very frustrating every night trying to get them done. Going to an internet cafe in the middle of the night wasn't quite what I had imagined doing. The location is amazing, but my room was the smallest I have ever had while traveling in Europe - even smaller than the hostels rooms I have stayed in, and the front desk was pretty unhelpful and didn't seem to care much that their internet didn't work. Will definitely stay elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Mojo_6674
Reviews.Content: Hotel is not the most luxurious but very clean and spacious. Very friendly staff and with lots of tips to help you out. Good wifi range. Also has an outside deck on the roof top if you care to bring some wine and food from local markets (bread, cheese, cold cuts etc...) Location and price is what we found great. You really are as close as you can get to the major sites in Rome. I can't promise your experience will be good as ours, but it was difficult to find anything wrong with this place.

Reviews.Title: “Fairly Good”
Reviews.Author: granitepeaker
Reviews.Content: I have sort of a mixed opinion of this hotel. We had reserved out months in advance room 77 with the loft and balcony and just a few days in advance they email me saying they are bumping us from that room and giving us room 70 and 71. They were courteous enough to honor the same price. This hotel is strictly 3 star. Although the rooms they gave us are so called "superior" rooms, I'm nervous to see what the other rooms look like. They claimed to have been remodeled fairly recently but lots of the things in the bathroom were peeling, rusted, cracked, or had mold. The mini fridge, although on the coldest setting, never got cold either. The maid would turn off our ac every day and open up the windows. I can understand turning off the ac, but take concern with the safety of opening up our windows. Room 71 was of alright size, but room 70 was very tiny. The so called included breakfast was the worst breakfast we had experienced in all the hotels we stayed at across Europe. There were no meats, cheeses, or fruit. The front desk was very helpful with knowledge of the area. The location is great and the street surroundings very safe. Next time in Rome will book closer to the Trevi Fountain to be more centrally located although walking distances were never bad. 5 min to Spanish Steps, 7 min to Trevi ... additional 5 min to pantheon, and an additional 5 min more from pantheon to piazza novona. The hotel had free wireless internet, but it was very slow.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great place to stay in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: monkey028
Reviews.Content: This hotel is tucked away near the high fashion shops, the Spanish Steps, and within walking distance of many tourist attractions. The rooms are large compared to many European hotels, and very comfortable. Breakfast is included and wif-fi is free with your room. Wi-fi is only available in the main building. Staff are very helpful. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best location”
Reviews.Author: Wave94
Reviews.Content: First time at San Carlo. Very nice staff. Our room was in the annex. It was fairly roomy but did not feel clean--probably because bathroom fixtures were older and well caulked.The hotel's location was perfect. Never made the free breakfast but they offered to deliver it to our room which was in a building around the corner. Not able to connect to free wifi in hotel lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, awful bed”
Reviews.Author: Italy_romance
Reviews.Content: The hotel wasn't all bad but was a disappointment after our wonderful hotels in Italy. I would not stay there again. If location is all you need, it would be perfect. Located in the same street as the Spanish steps! Breakfast was very limited. Hotel staff the friendliest we found in Italy. The bed was awful! So hard and uncomfortable. The duvet wasn't covered. Very noisy when other guests return at night. Ask for a room with a balcony- it's great for extra space. Tiny bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, awful bed”
Reviews.Author: kamp54
Reviews.Content: Terrific hotel in many respects - great location on a quiet pedestrian-only street near the Spanish Steps, super-modern on the inside with lots of high polished white marble, a new elevator, controls in each room for heat and air-conditioning, wireless internet, helpful staff, basic breakfast fare (no fruit), lovely terrace on the 4th floor. A "single" room provided a rock hard bed that seemed to be even smaller than a standard twin. But for the bed, it would be a perfect three star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Journalist and Rome-lover from Denmark”
Reviews.Author: BentsenBerg
Reviews.Content: The last many years we have travelled to Rome in the springtime, but this year it was our first and not last stay at San Carlo. It’s one of the best hotels, we have tried in Rome: Very nice and helpfull staff, good and clean room, central placement near most of the historical Rome and yet very quit neighbourhood. We will return!

Reviews.Title: “Our second stay, we'll make it a third one day.”
Reviews.Author: MAS2009Doubleview
Reviews.Content: This is a good, clean hotel in an excellent location. The decent rate, location, reliable staff and clean well appointed rooms brought us back to this hotel after our first Rome trip from Australia in 2006. The Spanish Steps location is magnificent. As this is one of the most upmarket parts of old Rome, the Hotel San Carlo (via delle Carrozze) is an excellent find. The Metro is close by, taxis are abundant at the Spanish Steps (a minute away) and one can walk most every where from here anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, otherwise sketchy”
Reviews.Author: DeniseLaw
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a trip to Rome and Florence in January and stayed at the San Carlos for four nights. This was my third trip to Italy in the past 18 months. The purpose of this trip was to escort two college girls to their new home in Florence for a semester of college. We spent the first 5 nights in Rome to do some sight seeing before embarking to Florence for 4 days. We wanted to get a hotel in Rome that was reasonably priced but close to the Spanish Steps. After much research, we decided to stay at the San Carlos Hotel because of its great location and competitive price. There were some other issues with the hotel that left me with a bad taste. Cons: Very loud; the entire hotel has marble floors including all the hallways, lobby, rooms and elevators. Anytime another guest closed their door, walked down the hall, entered the elevator or sneezed, it echoed throughout the entire hotel. It was very hard to get a good night sleep even with ear plugs. Cold rooms- the management had control of the heat in each room and we had to call several times a day to request they turn it on. Even when it was on, the rooms were cold. The last day of our stay there, they would not turn on the heat at all. I think this was because we were leaving although they said the heating system was broken. I had to sleep in long underwear and extra blankets and my nose and face were still freezing. My room, #43, warmed up to some extent but the other room, #41, was freezing the entire time. The doors to the rooms do no always lock when you close them. Check this before you go. No doorman- there was no full time doorman to help with luggage or screen entrants to the hotel. Not all the rooms are renovated and those that are not are in great need of update, we had two of these rooms. My room, #43, had no safe and smelled like sewage part of the time as the ventilation was not good. It seemed to me that the hotel management kept the renovated rooms empty to avoid the heating expense. Here is the event that the really made me uncomfortable with this hotel: On our first night stay at the San Carlos, three male guests that were staying on our floor came in after a night of partying at 1:30 AM. We were all in the lobby using the computer when they arrived. One of the guests in this party was so drunk, that the other two guys had to literally drag and carry him. There was an older lady at the front desk working the night shift. The 3 guys proceeded through the lobby, to the elevator, went to the 4th floor, all the while carrying the drunk passed out guy. Upon exiting the elevator, the drunk man, vomitted all over the hallway outside the elevater in front of our rooms. I went down to front desk to tell the clerk to send someone up to clean up the vomit. I ran into one of the drunk men who also went to the front desk. When he heard me tell the clerk about the vomit, he completely went off on me and the clerk. I was very scared. For the next 2 hours these guys were yelling, moaning, partying in their rooms until 4:00 am. The clerk called us around 3:00 AM and told us to make sure the doors to the terrace were locked as we shared a terrace with them. The next day, I complained to the owner about this situation and he apologized, down playing the situation. These three guys were at the hotel for the next 3 days. I assume the owner wanted their money more than peace and safety for the other guests. PROS: The maids and management were very nice. The owner let us check in early and did give us a free ride to the train station. They were also very generous with their computer and had free WIFI. The breakfasts were very average but they made delicious expresso drinks which were also free. The ice maker was broken the entire time so all drinks were served luke warm. The restaurant to the right of the hotel as you are leaving has good food and excellent expresso drinks for 1E if you get it "to go". Would I take the risk and stay here again.....probably not.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: plasma800
Reviews.Content: Let me begin with what is great about Hotel San Carlo! The Hotel San Carlo just simply could not be in a better location. The area around the hotel, the spanish steps, is by far the nicest area in Rome period. You feel safe, the shops are fantastic, the people are nice and you can walk anywhere from there! The Hotel San Carlo is super clean. Inside and out from what I saw, it was always clean. My room(s) were clean, bathroom clean, lift clean, everything clean..and that's important. The staff was super helpful and incredibly friendly. That's important to me too. Everyone was always there for you and I like that. No one stole anything from my room, thank goodness. No surprises on the bill! Exactly as advertised. Had the superior, fridge was nice and we had a semi private terrace which was great! When we returned on New Years eve (after some time in florence) they gave us the room on the roof, which was very nice to watch the fireworks from. Very cool people operating this hotel! Now for what I wasn't too impressed with. After 5 nights on that mattress I wanted to throw it out the window.. hard brickish thing just almost killed me! Pillows... flat tiny things.. I missed my bed at home, but you endure cause everything is so nice. The second room they gave us was a little better when we returned from Florence. But don't expect the Ritz. But who cares, YOU'RE IN ROME! Who wants to sleep anyway. The AC / heater unit in the room was a tad dirty, smelled a bit musty. Wireless internet in rooms.. hmm well, it just didn't really work did it. Worked downstairs though. All in all, a wonderful place to stay and I would certainly recommend anyone check it out. For the Price, it was quite brilliant and I'm so thankful it was clean! So to that end, I give it 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: “my favorite hotel”
Reviews.Author: grondahlanders
Reviews.Content: After 30 years of travelling to Rome, and over 30 hotels tested, San Carlo near The Spanish Steps has become one of my absolute favorites. Anders Gröndahl, Denmark Journalist and author of 12 books about Rome and its restaurants

Reviews.Title: “would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: kw711
Reviews.Content: GREAT hotel, wonderful location, and absolutely fabulous breakfast in my opinion!!

Reviews.Title: “Very very good and nice.”
Reviews.Author: erikageroji
Reviews.Content: Very good location, very clean in the room. Very helpful girl in the reception. Definetly would stay again in this hotel. Highly recomended.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: AAAKaunas
Reviews.Content: Very pleasing and helpful staff. very nice and tidy rooms. This hotel is in a good location, around this hotel is good shopping palces. I like this hotel very much.

Reviews.Title: “NICE PLACE (:”
Reviews.Author: witek25l
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from San Carlo,in a super location just 2minutes walking ,from Spanish Steps

Reviews.Title: “Beware - Not All Rooms Are Renovated”
Reviews.Author: dcapple
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel San Carlo for three nights in October and was given Room 12. It was a spacious room, but in desperate need of a renovation. The bathtub was stained and the tiles had some mold. The hair dryer in my room fell apart and the closet needed to be fixed. One morning there was no hot water at all and when I reported it to the man at the front desk, he acted as if he did not even want to talk to me! Had I known that there were rooms that had been renovated, I would have asked for one at check in. The one thing that bothers me about the whole situation is that I was the only one assigned a room in that section of the hotel. At breakfast, I saw quite a few people who were coming from the renovated side. Could it be because I am a minority and management mistook me for one of their hired help? The only good thing about the hotel is the location and the bellman, who did not complain when he had to lug my heavy suitcases. The hotel is very convenient to shopping, sightseeing, restaurants, and transportation. I would definitely stay in this area again, but not at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: SdR08
Reviews.Content: Thanks to all the Tripadvisor reviewers we booked The Hotel San Carlo for 3 nights in Rome. The hotel is situated in a small streets about 4 blocks from the Spanish Steps. Our room was in the "annex" building, which is around the corner from the hotel address. The room was a double, spacious and clean, with a small bathroom and an even smaller shower - prefab, one person shower - no problems, because the location is perfect. Very quiet at night, hard to believe since all the streets are so crowded during the day - lots of good restaurants to chose from - the restaurant across from the hotel - Toto - expensive and not very good - you can do better by walking around the area. The hotel offers breakfast every morning, cereals, yogurt, coffee, juices and pastries. The breakfast are is small, but we always found a table to sit at. The lady who serves breakfast was very nice. Overall, the Hotel San Carlo is a good hotel to stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Eggie84
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel San Carlo with my husband and 8 year old daughter for 8 nights in August 2009. It was an absolutely perfect location near the Spagna Metropolitana station and the Spanish Steps. We had a room that had two separate bedrooms so our daughter could go to sleep without having us pretending to be asleep in the next bed. The only drawback was that her room did not have an air conditioner unit but it did have a fan. Unfortunately there was not an electrical outlet in the room so her door had to stay somewhat ajar to plug in the fan. That was actually good because when the door closed, it locked and we did not want her to be locked in. In spite of these minor annoyances, it worked fine for us. The hotel is on a very quiet street so it is surprising tranquil for its location. The breakfast was fine (breads, cereals; no fruit or meats) and the cappuccino was great. We would definitely choose the San Carlo again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location & owner of hotel made us feel very welcome!”
Reviews.Author: LAHDBA
Reviews.Content: Ramona was awesome. Stayed 3 days and didn't want to leave. Warm, quaint hotel with modern amenities. They made us feel very welcome which is unusual in today's world. Extremely helpful for getting us everyplace we wanted to go including making reservations. Left our pillow there, e-mailed them & they had it waiting 2 weeks later. As a single mom with 20 year old daughter it was extremely important that we were in a good safe location. For the price & only a 3 star we were really happy! Thank you for everything 'Hotel San Carlo'! Great complimentary breakfast & cappuccinos’ too!

Reviews.Title: “Small and nice hotel in a terrific location”
Reviews.Author: Ambrosiano
Reviews.Content: I travel to Rome often to meet friends. I have visited the hotel twice and I am every time satisfied. I always try to stay in the dependance, few rooms in a separate building. It seems to have your own flat in Roma. Helpful staff, decent breakfast and top-notch location.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifull trip”
Reviews.Author: donnaMidlothian
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice trip in rome, we loved this hotel, our room was comfortable and spotless with a terrace where we relaxed and taste a good wine after all day walking and shopping. the staff was helpfull and friendly. We hope to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: Plaztik
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week's stay at the Hotel San Carlo. Great location near the Spanish Steps and Via del Corso. Nice rooms and it felt safe. The breakfast was more than adequate with fruit, pastries, yougurt, cereal, juices, and coffee. Two points to note. Of the three rooms my family had none had a bathtub if that is a problem. They also have an energy management system that requires your key (card) to be in a slot in the room. Not a problem unless you are trying to charge something or have a device that requires constant electricity while you are out. The staff was very helpful this several excellent restaurant recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel San Carlo”
Reviews.Author: Sangestein
Reviews.Content: Value and location gem! My husband and I stayed at this hotel for eight nights in late May, early June, 2009. The location is primo - luxe shops during the day, Spanish steps and Villa Borghese nearby, quiet nights, plenty of excellent restaurants, and walking distance to most of the major tourist attractions in the historic city center. We were lucky to get a room with a private terrace (41) which made our accomodations into a suite - a small but comfortable bedroom and our outdoor living space. Breakfast trays were brought up to the terrace each morning - coffee, steamed milk, pastries, yogurt, fruit - and we had wine from the surrounding wine shops al fresco in the afternoon. The hotel was spotless, excellent maid service, good A/C, and the staff was pleasant but unobtrusive. The price was right, and we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: giveittomestratight
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel San Carlo on 5/21-5/25 in room 77, a quadruple with a terrace and loved it! Our room was very comfortable with plenty of closet space, hardwood floors, windows that went from the ceiling to the floor, a loft with two single beds upstairs, a very comfortable bathroom well equiped, and the best part, a beautiful terrace with furniture and plants and a view to the rooftops nearby as well as the church of San Carlo's duomo. We enjoyed the breakfast each day in the lounge, the coffee was wonderful. The location of this hotel is really superior in via della Carroze, a few steps from the Spanish Steps and close to Piazza del Popolo and Fontana di Trevi. This area is beautiful with great restaurants and outdoor cafes. I recommend Edy's for dinner. Just ask the nice lady that is in the front desk every afternoon. All of the staff was very helpful but I especially got impressed by this older lady who I didn't ask her name but who was sooooo helpful in every way. Whether it was recommendations for restaurants, tours, arranging reservations, looking after my mother when we took a day tour to Capri and left her to take a tour to Tivoli. Grazie, grazie, grazie!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Paris10
Reviews.Content: Huge room, with an equally large balcony. I have stayed in rooms in Europe that were smaller than the balcony. Location is good but you do need to do a little walking which is fine when you are in rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and price”
Reviews.Author: NycTraveler25
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on our Honeymoon for the 4 days we spent in Rome. This hotel could not be better positioned. It is right up the block from the Spanish steps which you can see out of the window. The streets aroung have great shopping and the restaurant next door has amazing food. The hotel has an included breakfast which is simple and you're better off spending the time out and about and walk into a little cafe and get their pastries. The room is quite nice and has shutters just like all of the other hotels. At night it is quiet but during day its bustling. The front desk could have been a bit more enthusiastic but if I'm ever in Rome this would definitely be on the list.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Hotel in the Heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Pdelis50
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights in February, 2009 Clean hotel in a great location near all of the sights as mentioned by other recent posts, price was reasonable in the heart of the city. Very comfortable Hotel, quiet at night. Staff was helpful and knowling Italian was very helpful( English was also spoken) The hotel made three Excellent dinner reservations for us, all nearby. Would stay again, if went back

Reviews.Title: “great location, reasonably priced, very clean”
Reviews.Author: z235e49
Reviews.Content: just got back from 6 nites at the san carlo. great location- near the piazza spagna- its metro station and taxi stand was 5 minutes away. we walked to the piazza popolo, piazza navona, pantheon, trevi fountain, spanish steps, piazza colonna and a number of churches and took the metro to the vatican and other places further out. a number of excellent restaurants were within a reasonable walk. the hotel was immaculate. the shower pressure was excellent. we had an internet problem during our stay. the hotel told us that there would be internet service in our room. they were having problems with the service during our stay and for a few days it did not work in our room. they offerred to move us but we had a room with a terrace and the other rooms did not so we did not want to move to a lesser room. instead at night, they gave us the key to a different room that was unoccupied that had working internet - it was a little inconvenient but they tried to make us happy. after the third day, the internet was fixed in our room. when we checked out, they willingly gave us a discount off of the agreed price for our troubles. the staff were very friendly and tried hard to please. drawbacks- the rooms were on the small size. the elevator could only fit 2 people at one time. the breakfast was ordinary. all in all- the location, cleanliness, price and friendliness of the staff outweighed the drawbacks and our stay was quite pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, attentive staff, large rooms, good value for money.”
Reviews.Author: GGAC
Reviews.Content: I have now been a number of times to Hotel San Carlo over the last four years and have constantly found improvements to the Hotel and great attention to Customers by both managers and staff. I certainly recommend it for the location next to the "Spanish Steps" and the "Via del Corso" where everything is walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: DLS53
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at San Carlo. You can not find a better location for the price. We were just steps away from the Spanish Steps and the up-scale shopping district and only a short walk to the main attractions of central Rome. The rooms were clean and comfortable, the staff pleasant, and the location quite. This is our fourth time at the hotel and we will definitely come again!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel and location for the price! Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: HWFMemphis
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the San Carlo the week before Christmas (and in November of 08, as well). Our friends and their three school-aged children were with us and everyone had a wonderful stay. The staff goes out of its way to accomodate families and those whose Italian skills are modest (like mine!). The rooms are lovely and the bathrooms have been upgraded since our first trip here five years ago. The towels and amenities are plentiful, as is the breakfast, although we seldom take advantage of it. Our room (and our friends' room) had a balcony- with the mild winter, it was fantastic to sit outside and enjoy a glass of wine. The rooms all have small refrigerators to store any leftovers. The staff holds bags while you shop and deposits them in your room. I really cannot say enough good things about this property or its wonderful staff! Best location imaginable, particularly for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Margaretcork
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from Rome. Stayed at Hotel San Carlo for the 8th time. Wonderful as ever. Great location and the staff are excellent. The rooms are very good and breakfast is very good. I highly recommend the San Carlo and look forward to my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel San Carlo”
Reviews.Author: trishf
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as a single traveler in November 08. Warm welcome from the lovely lady at the desk. Tiny lift, but big enough for me and my bags. My stay was for four nights and the first one I had a triple due to current bookings. Very nice and not much street noise. For the last three nights I was moved to a single which was perfect for me, clean and comfortable. Although my room faced Via della Corrozze, the street noise was not significant. Breakfast was excellent, good cafe latte, yogurt, baked goods and juices. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Visit with Parents”
Reviews.Author: FatherRich
Reviews.Content: My parents and I stayed for a week at the Hotel San Carlo. This was their first trip to Europe and we truly appreciated all of the service and attention we received from the hotel's staff. They were extremely helpful and were always ready to answer our many questions. Before we checked in, they showed us several room options and were amiable to our requests. The front desk staff and the bellhops were always friendly and helpful. They even offered a courtesy car to drive my parents to St. Peter's. The location is excellent with many shops and restaurants choices within just a few blocks. It was also nice to have the Spagna metro stop so close. Our rooms were very clean and comfortable and one of them sported a beautiful patio terrace. We really had no complaints and would certainly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: carleric
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel. Great location with plenty of sights, food and shopping to walk to. Taxis are two blocks away. Rooms are nice and clean. Breakfast was great - pastries, fresh fruit, juice, cereal, coffee. Make sure you request the room with a roof-top terrace, it is totally worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Tira_20
Reviews.Content: Great location in the heart of Rome. Great dining in the nearby neighborghood. The rooms was alright, but the service in the reception and cleaning of the rooms was under average. The breakfast buffet is small, but ok.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location plus coffee”
Reviews.Author: hdelbucc
Reviews.Content: Located in a very nice district and a stones throw from the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, metro, taxis, great food and shopping. I sent an email that we would be arriving early in the morning and our room was ready when we arrived (sweet). I stayed in 4 hotels in Italy and all were 3 star rated. This room was the most up to date with nicest bathroom We traveled with another couple. Our room and bathroom were larger than theirs but they had a patio off the room. So rooms can vary for the same price. Staff was great and of all the hotels we stayed in had the best coffee at breakfast but overall breakfast was average compared to the others.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: alisonyoung97
Reviews.Content: Great location, great service, this was my 3rd time to stay in the Hotel San Carlo and each time, i have received a great service, Breakfast is basic and can some times be a little crowded but you will always be welcomed and found a seat asap.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: SydneyJade
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived we received outstanding service. The staff were very friendly and helpful and our room was amazing - very spacious, quiet and clean (we even had our own private terrace). The hotel is in a great location and we were able to walk to all the main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad...Not amazing...”
Reviews.Author: Tal1976
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights and like someone else said, its an ok place to crash after walking your socks off all day in sweaty summer rome... but the breakfast was poor, the service not the most friendly, and the room layed out strangely with the TV in the wrong position so it was hard to watch it from the bed, then again, there's only CNN or MTV in English so thats not really a huge issue. The bathroom was very nice, but the hot water wasn't very hot and sometimes varied from scolding to freezing within 20 seconds... Like I said, the hotel isn't all that bad, it has wifi internet, and a really great location, so after only a few days you really know the heart of Rome, as your hotel is right in it !

Reviews.Title: “super little hotel”
Reviews.Author: blufox8
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on the hotels own website and what a perfect location! We were welcomed by friendly staff and we were given a lovely double room in the hotel annexe just around the corner. The hotel only does breakfast but did not matter as there were loads of super restaurants and bars in the immediate vicinity. Cannot say a bad thing about the hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: TanyaBkk
Reviews.Content: Loves everything during our first 2 nights in Rome until we came back again on our last night in Italy. They asked us to change the hotel without prior notice or explanation (this happend even when we have all the reservation confirmed!!!). They offered a new hotel nearby with the same charge. The new hotel was much smaller. We later found out that the new hotel was acutally nearly half the price of this hotel. We are very disappointed at the Hotel for not honoring its reservation and worse offer no explanation or apology.

Reviews.Title: “Absoutely outstanding”
Reviews.Author: GvFoss
Reviews.Content: The San Carlo was a terrific stay for three nights. We reserved a Superior Double that was upgraded to the quadruple. The room was truly Superior with a roof terrace, LCD tv, free wifi, immaculately clean, well decorated, and very delightful. The included breakfast was nice, the service excellent, the elevator very small but quite satisfactory, and the location near the Spanish Steps was perfect. We do enjoy a smaller type hotel and this one with only 80 rooms far exceeded our expectations. All hotels in Rome at this time of year are very expensive but this one is an excellent value for Rome. We did not see into a Standard room so are speaking our satisfaction for the Superior rooms and public areas although the public areas are small. Gary V Tulsa, OK

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Denver007Traveler
Reviews.Content: The location of Hotel San Carlo is hard to beat -- right near the Spanish Steps, great restaurants, shopping and a 15 minute walk from the Villa Borghese. Based upon what we had read here on Trip Advisor, we requested the terrace room, and upon checking in, we were given that room -- at no extra charge. We had the top floor of the hotel to ourselves! The room was small, but the outdoor terrace wasn't!

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel, wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: crwnjlz
Reviews.Content: Hotel San Carlo could not have a better location! It is a short walk from the Spanish Steps and the Spagna Metro Station with excellent restaurants and shops nearby. While the room was small, it was all I really needed. The included breakfast was pretty substantial and abundant compared to others that I have seen. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a relaxing stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jcgso
Reviews.Content: Hotel San Carlo is located just two blocks from the Spanish Steps and the Metro. The fourth floor room we had was very large, clean and quiet and included a roof top terrace. The staff was very helpful and spoke English. The breakfast was decent, typical for a Roman hotel. There is no elevator, which we were aware of, so it's quite a hike after a long day on foot. We would stay at the San Carlo again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice People, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: SoftwareBug
Reviews.Content: Recently spent two nights in Rome at this little hotel. It's on a fairly quiet street about 150 meters from the Spanish Steps. The staff was friendly. There was a small, so-so continental breakfast (e.g. cereal and milk and juice). My room was a "single" -- tiny by U.S. standards, but clean, comfortable , and fine for my purposes, considering I was there to see Rome, not relax in the hotel room. The bed was small, and the bathroom was smaller. (Large folks might have difficulty maneuvering in the bathroom. I would recommend a larger room with larger bathroom if that applies to you.) The windows appeared new, and were the type seen a lot in Europe that can either be opened completely or tilted open from the top. They did an excellent job of shutting out street noise at night. It's a 3 minute walk to the Spanish Steps. Maybe 10-15 minutes to the Trevi fountain. The Pantheon and the Piazza Navona are also within walking distance. I recommend jumping on the metro (subway) at the Spanish Steps to go to the Colosseum area. It's only 2 Euros round trip. And any of the sites are reachable via taxi (roughly 10 Euros to the Colosseum and 10-15 Euros to the Vatican), if you want to avoid the buses and the metro. There's a taxi stand at the base of the Spanish Steps. The cost was 125 Euros/night. Overall, I would definitely stay here again, although I would get a larger room if I planned to spend more time relaxing at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back”
Reviews.Author: lpmCopenhagen
Reviews.Content: Family with one teenage child stayed in a triple ( superior ) room at San Carlo for 6 days - and loved it. The rooms, though slightly run-down, are fine and very, very clean. Although the location is right in the middle of Rome, it is absolutely quiet. Staff very kind and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel, with excellent rooms and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: dokelly
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights and very much enjoyed our stay. The reception staff were extremely friendly and helpful and made us welcome from the first moment we arrived, pointing out nearby sights on the map. Our room was on the 4th floor, and there was no elevator, but there was a baggage carrier there who carried all baggage up to upper floors. The room itself was lovely, immaculately clean with high quality furnishings. We had a room with a private terrace which was an added bonus. The location is excellent, very close to the Spanish Steps and associated metro station. The area is known as the location for all the designer shops, so the streets around are relatively posh, and there are a number of good restaurants located nearby. We took advantage of the dry cleaning service here as we had been travelling through Italy for 2 weeks, and this service was excellent and very affordable. To summarise, I would recommend this hotel due to its location, good value for money, amiable staff and high quality rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Recommend Hotel San Carlo”
Reviews.Author: lmjeffer
Reviews.Content: I was so glad to see the the Hotel San Carlo featured on Trip Advisor! I stayed there last year and thought it was a perfect and quaint Roman inn. Although it's nothing too extravagent, it has great Italian charm, is very clean and classy, and has a great location! It's very near the Spanish Steps and we felt like we were in the hub of the city. Definitely a winner if you're looking not to spend too much, but still want a lovely, worry-free hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great little place for a honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: mhoehler
Reviews.Content: We began our honeymoon here, and were very, very pleased. For full disclosure, I will echo what a previous poster said... the elevator was broken, and the lobby is very tiny. The hotel itself is on the tiny streets by the Spanish steps around all of the designer shops and restaurants, so space is at a premium. The hotel definitely makes up for it, though. The bathrooms were spotless and modern, the room was comfortable. The breakfast is just what you need to get going in the morning. The staff was happy to answer any question I had, and we were given one of the private terrace rooms... a nice touch of luxury for honeymoon on a budget. My wife and I were amazed at how quickly we felt at home at this hotel, how waking up, getting a pastry and cappuccino together before running out to explore became one of our most treasured memories of our time in Italy. Of all the hotels on our tour of Italy, this was our favorite.

Reviews.Title: “I really Like the San Carlo”
Reviews.Author: WillyEckerlyke
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the San Carlo (in the Annex) in 2000 for a friend's wedding at the same time of year and really liked it then. This year we went back with our children and the in-laws. The boys stayed with us in the Quadruple which is the best room in the hotel - pics on website, and our daughter stayed with the in-laws in a superior triple and had her own (single) bedroom.in their suite. Yes it is an issue staying on the top floor with no lift, but this was more than made up for by the fantastic room and roof terrace were we all took some of our evening meals (pinic from SPAR shop). The breakfast room isn't great but is perfectly acceptable; breakfast used to be up on the roof terrace, but presumably the lift issue put paid to that. The rooms were very well finished, the staff were all very pleasant and helpful (as last time), the rooms were quiet and the location is very central with most of the main sites within walking distance. I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: jotabecu
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here 3 times, always at the annex (it has a lift). I certainly recommend it for its value and location. Several friends have also stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem”
Reviews.Author: DJB58
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here three times in the past two years and its been a great find. Not sure why its fallen lower on the favorites list, I think it was number 3 when I first saw it. Location is perfect if you want to be in the midst of Gucci et al for high end shopping. Otherwise most of the tourist sites are easy walking. 10 min stroll to Trevi Fountain etc. The hotel is about 200 yards from the Spanish Steps if that gives you some perspective. Rooms can be small, but this is Rome. Staff is great, the free wireless works fine. No complaints. However if you can't climb stairs, book elsewhere. By the way, a lot of smaller hotels in Rome don't have elevators either. For a terrific experience try the Italian Wine Sampling Tour with Heather at Context Tours. A certified sommelier, she has great knowledge and is able to connect with everyone from wine newbies to snobs. ABSOLUTELY the best tour for experiencing this most civilized way of life.
