Great Stuff.

Reviews.Title: “A little Good - A lot of Bad”
Reviews.Author: MilitelloVC
Reviews.Content: I really hate to say this because I liked the manager, but my money belt was stolen from my bag while I was out of the room. I didn't notice until I was in the cab leaving the hotel. The room was the only - and I mean only - place it could have been taken. I am careful with my money belt; the last day I was there I didn't take it with me. However, whoever took it would have had to go through my bags. I can't fault the owner for that (or maybe I can if he has had previous complaints). Until that point I was impressed with the hotel if only for the location and the helpfulness of the staff. Now, I won't be returning. If you do book the San Carlo, just be careful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but stay away from the annex”
Reviews.Author: pclark19
Reviews.Content: Our first impressions of the hotel were not great when after we checked in with the front desk we were taken down the street to the "annex rooms". You should avoid the annex if all the rooms are like the one we stayed in. It was spacious, but very "tired" and depressing. . .especially for 210 Euros per night. I called the front desk and they said they did not have a superior double in the main hotel for that night, but that we could move for the last three nights of our stay. We were very happy with the "new" room. Very spacious (including the bathroom), clean, good AC, quiet. You could tell that everything in the room had been upgraded in the past year or so. We were on the 4th floor with a private area on the common terrace. The hotel is very central and we were able to walk everywhere. Overall, we were happy with our stay and the front desk discounted the rate for the first night by 30 euros. However, when booking be sure to get a commitment that you will not have to stay in the annex. It is to be avoided at all cost!

Reviews.Title: “Not luxury but perfect location and great staff”
Reviews.Author: ScubaNYC16
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in October. It's a nice small 3 star hotel. Standard double was on the small side but clean and modern. The hotel staff was very helpful and friendly and at 185 euro for a double including tax and breakfast was a great deal compared to other hotels at the time. Location is the best feature of this hotel. Just a few blocks from Spanish Steps and Via Condotti. We only took 1 taxi from hotel as almost everything is within walking distance. Within 15-20 min, you can walk to Colloseum, Piazza Novonna, Pantheon, Trevi Fountain and many other sites. Spagna metro stop is also just a few min walk away.

Reviews.Title: “clean and decent, ok if you don't plan to stay too long..great location though!”
Reviews.Author: MNKhawaja
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the San Carlo for a couple of days while in Rome. The hotel is located walking distance from the Spanish Steps (Spagna), a buzz of activity during the day and nightime. Other major attractions (Trevi Fountain, Pantheon) are also not too far away (i.e. withing walking distance). There are also quite a few major high street stores nearby, so location-wise no complaints. Front desk are cordial and credit to them for telling us where San Eustachio coffee house was (Italy's best coffee place).. Our room was pretty small though we were staying in a double room. it was neat and clean though and airconditioning worked fine. Also a good thing is a free minibar (though only water is provided) .. at the end of the day its a good enough room for putting your bags down and spending the day exploring Rome! Couple of negative points: Breakfast downstairs was disappointing.. pastries/cakes seemed a bit stale and the spread was extremely basic, as was the setting of the breakfast ... Our room was on the 4th floor and there were no elevators, so climbing up after a hard day's sight seeing was not what we were in the mood for ;) ... felt a bit sorry for the bellboy who lugged our luggage up, poor guy was in sweats! However, at the end of the day, the hotel suited our needs which were: a decent place to stay while sight seeing and a decent location. A tad bit expensive though at 130 - 140 Euros a night .. but I suppose thats Rome for you!

Reviews.Title: “Superb location and staff”
Reviews.Author: Marc050869
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a wonderful stay at Hotel San Carlo. I'll get to the good stuff in just a sec. The negatives were few but should be noted. The hotel does not have an elevator. Taxis cannot access the hotel. A taxi will drop you at the corner and there is a short walk to the hotel front ( 1 quick block or so). The bathrooms are small and narrow but we managed just fine. Breakfast is minimal and sweet but decent. Just as long as you are not trying to get a table during the rush as there are only 9-10 small tables. Basic cereal, coffee, rolls, yogurt, juice and a few pastries but definitely a decent start to your day. The hotel is charming, warm and convenient. The staff could not be more helpful and all we encountered spoke English fairly well. Everything we wanted was at our disposal...restaurants, spanish steps, trevi fountain, vatican, coliseum, pantheon, metro trains, termini station (trains) and shopping galore were all either within a few blocks or within a 15 min walk. We stayed at the top floor with a charming terrace. Even though there is no elevator the concierge will gladly carry bags up the numerous flights of stairs as well as down the street to meet your cab. The staff printed train schedules, made excellent recommendations, allowed us free internet access and even solved a maintance issue quickly. I definitely recommmend Hotel San Carlo and look forward to returning soon. Marc Goohs Chicago, IL

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful relaxing stay at Hotel San Carlo.”
Reviews.Author: CiaranHughes
Reviews.Content: We came to Rome for our friends wedding and stayed here for 4 nights from September 8th – 12th. The staff were extremely pleasant and helpful and the superior room on the 3rd floor was spacious and clean. The location is fantastic – in a cobblestone side street close to the Spanish steps but away from all the crowds. Most areas are in easy walking distance from the hotel as are plenty of good restaurants. Try getting lost in Rome!, every corner you turn there is a beautiful building, monument or square. We will definitely return to this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “So good we returned 3 times”
Reviews.Author: carina1983
Reviews.Content: Hotel San Carlo Roma is a great hotel... we stayed there 3 times in 6 weeks and it was worth its euro. The location is fantastic - close to Spanish steps and just off Via Del Corso, a main shopping strip. It is also not a very long walk to Trevi Fountain & Pantheon. The rooms at San Carlo are immaculate and elegantly furnished. We have experienced the triple room, the double and the single room and all were good. The only slight downfall is that there is no elevator so if you are on the 4th floor (as we were once) its a bit of a hike up those stairs but on the plus side, you can burn off the calories from the loads of gelati on offer in all the places near the hotel. The staff were friendly and helpful, the location outstanding and the price reasonable too - especially for the centre of roma. Highly recommended to all and we will return to Hotel San Carlo in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and Quaint”
Reviews.Author: brooke16
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on a small cobblestone street near the spanish steps and trevi fountain. We absolutly loved the location, it is in walking distance to all attractions( if you dont mind a 20-30 minute walk, which we didnt) It is 5 minutes from the Spanish Steps and like 10 from the Trevi fountain. The room was cute, it had the typical wooden shutters that you would see in most places in Rome which was wonderful, but I must say that being in the first floor it was extremely loud at night. It didnt bother us too much but I was woken up repeatedly throughout both nights of our stay. If you are a light sleeper I recommend that you ask for a room on higher floor, just remember there is no elevator so you will have to walk up the steps. The bathrooms also have the traditional old Italian shower, with no seperation from the rest of the bathroom which I do not mind but my boyfriend was not used to and did not love.The front desk was helpful and pleasant as well. I would definetly stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel/Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: anitainla
Reviews.Content: We were so happy with everything about this hotel. Yes, we had to walk up four floors to our rooms, but it is worth it to be in this neighborhood at such reasonable prices. Everyone behind the desk is helpful and friendly, and the breakfast was a welcome convenience and very tasty. We would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: jgrigs
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay at the Hotel San Carlo. We stayed in the rooftop room. LOVELY view with our own private terrace. Overlooked the narrow cobblestreet below. Great place to read and enjoy a glass of wine. Room was not fancy, but comfortable. The terrace made our stay here. However, if you are not very agile, I would not recommend the rooftop room. It was quite a trip down the narrow steps and difficult to get our lugguge up there. Hotel is in close proximity to the Spanish Steps. Courteous staff. They even mailed back my cashmere sweater I left in the room.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok”
Reviews.Author: T_Monstah
Reviews.Content: We were not too impressed by this hotel considering the amount of money we paid for our 3 night stay. We stayed in room 18. It was sparse even by European standards and had little by way of decoration. It seems that other rooms on higher floors might be better appointed than ours. The room and bathroom were very clean, but I wasn't expecting the shower with no curtain and only a drain in the floor. The AC worked well, mercifully, as it was extremely hot. The main thing you get with this hotel is the location. It is just minutes from the Spanish Steps and walking distance to many other sites of interest. It is also in the prime shopping district, which was helpful since we were stranded for all 3 days without our luggage (thanks to Alitalia, whom I will never fly again) and had to buy all new things. The staff at the desk were quite helpful in helping us track down our luggage (in the end, only one bag came and the other we had to go to the airport to get). The included breakfast was simple but we were glad for it.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, close to the Metro and Spanish Steps”
Reviews.Author: ladybug52
Reviews.Content: This hotel is good, but it is small there were 3 of us, so the room was tight but comfy. Remember that the european breakfast is cheeses, meats, fruit, yogurt, ceral, rolls. The breakfast served at the hotel is ample to get you started. Also this hotel is close to the Metro.....not the train station there is a difference. The most popular area to eat and just hang is the trevi and pantheon we spend most of our time there so 2 or 3 trips a day was quite tiring. Spanish Steps is a good stop to hang but kinda far from everything else. The train station is a couple miles away it was raining when we left for Florence so we took a taxi thank goodness. The average taxi fare is 13 to 20 euro my adult kids were not into taxis but sometimes it just better, especially when you are dragging luggage. If you go to Vatican make sure you book a tour the line 3 to 5 hours long. Have fun, Roxie

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: beachgirl269
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel! My husband and I spent three nights there in late May and absolutely loved the Hotel San Carlo. The rooms were large (for Europe standards) and very clean. The location is perfect, close to all major attractions, the best restaurants and shopping. The staff was great and breakfast was one of the best on our trip. We stayed on the top floor with a balcony that looked out over the street below (highly recommended). We can't wait to stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Little Gem In The Heart Of The Spanish Steps!”
Reviews.Author: andywine
Reviews.Content: Because of all of the great reviews this hotel received, we decided to go ahead and book it - for two nights in the beginning of our trip, and then for a single night at the end (were in Tuscany for the other nights). It was high season, so we paid 210Euro/night for a double superiour room. I requested a higher floor and were given room 78. This was on the 4th floor (top floor) and had a small balcony. The room was ok sized (as far as European hotels go) and the bathroom was very good. The room was extremely clean and adaquate in every way. The hard tile floors in the hallway made sound a little bit of an issue, but not one that would dissuade me from returning. The beds were comfortable and the water hot (and consistant!). Very, very nice. There is no lift, so climbing up the stairs gives you a nice workout (76 stairs) at the end of the day. For the last evening of our trip, we checked in and were given room 77. Just down the hall from 78, this was an immense room that was actually two stories (had a beautiful wooden staircase) with two single beds in the loft. Flatscreen TV, a very large bathroom and a very large patio area. A beautiful room!!!! We were extremely impressed with this hotel and would recommend this to anyone who wants to be in one of the best locations in Rome (shopping, dining, sights) and doesn't mind a hotel without a lift.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: Safura
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located in a prime spot and you can easily walk to all the major sites. Great shopping as well as wonderful restaurants in the neighborhood. I do agree that some of the rooms need more re-modeling. They have 2 buildings – one with an elevator and the other without an elevator. If you have problem with stairs, be sure to mention that you get a room in the other building. Staff was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “march 29th and 30th 2007”
Reviews.Author: spurg
Reviews.Content: location, location, location. Booked a single on hotel website, 2 nights at 115 euros per night--after reading the reviews on this site. When I checked in at 11:00 am they offered me room 21. Knowing this was a lower floor dog, I baulked and offered to wait. When I came back at 3, they gave me room 42, which is a tiny one on the back of the hotel with a great private terrace. Very quiet. Loved it. If you get a nice terrace , it makes a small room fine. bed was not as comfortable as the Sheraton Roma, but I loved this location. Went to a reception up the spanish steps at the Villa Medici. It's like disneyland for adults. The fired artichoke at Campana is mouth watering. It's not on the menu so make sure to ask for it. While there, I looked at other rooms at the hotel: There is also a room with a King bed that I would book when I come back with my wife--photos now up on their website. There is also a very cool room (59) that has a Queen bed, large bath with tub and is surrounded by a full terrace and balcony, but you have to go up a very narrow spiral staircase. Note: the hot water heater pump is located on the roof between 59 and 42 and clicks on an off at night -- i am light sleaper and it did keep me up. But the back side of the hotel is very quite and romantic. you only hear church bells and opera singers -- not kidding about this...can't wait to go back. I am not a breakfast eater so can not comment on that....there are lots of stairs to climb so do not book one of the top floor rooms if you are not fit. And don't stay here! There is a bit of luck getting a good room at this place, but if you do your research, you will be rewarded. Have fun! There is a phone call and internet place one street over. Bring your own laptop for free internet hotspot connection in the lobby. I was travelling light so I didn't bring mine. They no longer like guests to use their hotel computer. Although, in a pinch, they might let you. You can use the Piazza Spagna metro station if you are not carryiing much luggage and need to save $$. Otherwise, cab it to/from airport. A big Thank you to everyone on this site for turning me on to this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ElsiMM
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel is a good choice and located in the best part of town which is very chic and posh. The price is reasonable since your paying for location, your at walking distance to Spanish Steps, Villa Condotti, bus stops, numerous shops and restaurants. Other hotels in the area would cost you much more and at the end of the day, you get just an average hotel. For our trip, I decided to pay a little extra for a superior room, since it was the last stop of a 2 ½ week long trip and I knew that the extra space and luxury would be handy. The down side of having a superior room is that it’s located on the top floor and there is no lift, so you have to walk up several flights of stairs. The up side is that it helped to burn the extra calories I consumed eating gelato, pizza and pasta. The other good thing is that the porter does have access to a lift for luggage only, so you don’t have to worry about making that climb with your suitcases. The bedroom and bathroom were both spacious and clean. The furniture and linens were new and you could tell the room had recently been refurbished. The room had a comfortable bed, TV, and a nice size closet. We had a balcony with a table and two chairs. The balcony didn’t overlook anything special, just the roof top to other buildings nearby. I can understand why some of the comments mentioned that the rooms were in need of remodeling and that there was a lot of noise. While I was there, the hotel was in the midst of being renovated. The top floors had already been done and workers were remodeling other rooms and floors during my stay. However, none of the construction was done during the night time, the work didn’t interfere with your stay, there was no dust or mess left behind and I didn’t hear any outside noise while in my room during the evenings. Breakfast was very basic and consisted of pastries, cereal, jam, coffee and juice. The service was great and the employees are very attentive. They help make reservations for us and recommended some great restaurants as well as giving us great direction and calling taxi's when we needed. I would definitely consider staying there again in the future, unless my financial situation changes and I can afford to stay in a 5 star hotel :).

Reviews.Title: “quaint and perfect”
Reviews.Author: bluewater365
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for a week in June. The location is really perfect. Very close to all of the must-see attractions. The desk staff was helpful in suggesting restaurants and places to see. The rooms are small, which we expected, but comfortable and with a nice view of the tiny street below. The only complaint is that we did book an airport pickup, but the driver never arrived. They did apologize for forgetting to come get us and put a credit on the bill at the end. We would stay there again if we get the chance to return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location but needs to improve”
Reviews.Author: JamesMalta
Reviews.Content: Hotel is situated in the centre of Rome, just 5 minutes away from the Spanish stairs, service is okish but lacks the service of an elevator. We were allocated a room on the 4th floor, so had to go 4 flight of stairs at least twice a day. * Hotel staff are friendly. * B'fast can improve. * Rooms need a refurbishment, as mostly all the furniture is scratched and tiles on the floor need to be replaced (cracked).

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in ideal location”
Reviews.Author: hatty1
Reviews.Content: Just returned from three night stay at Hotel San Carlo. The superior triple room we had consisted of a suite of one large double and one single room with large well equiped bathroom in main hotel on 2nd floor. Well furnished, spotlessly clean and quiet rooms. Service and friendlinesss of hotel staff was great. Breakfast buffet of fruit juice, yoghurts, cereals, rolls, cakes and croissants was perfectly adequate, all with lots of good Italian coffee! The hotel is in a very central location in the fashionable shopping district near the Spanish Steps. We were able to walk to all main attractions and sights. Several good eating places nearby. Would highly recommend to couples, families or small groups of friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel -Location Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: BoroBoy2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the San Carlo in early November 2006 for three nights. It was a 40th Birthday celebration with my wife and a couple of friends. I have got to say we had a fantastic time - this is a lovely little hotel and the thing that is very noticeable is the friendliness of the hotel staff - everyone from the receptionists through to the cleaning staff. In terms of location you can't really get much better. Located in Via del Carozze, it is literally minutes away from the Spanish steps, about 20 minutes walking (brisk) from the Vatican City, same from the Trevi fountain, and about half an hour from the Coliseum. If you don't fancy the hike to any of these, then the taxis are reasonable ( 5-8 euros to any of the above) There are some great little bars and restaurants in and around the little streets around the hotel, and as this is Rome's premier shopping area, you will be spoilt for choice for clothes, designerwear, sunglasses, leather goods etc. Fantastic shopping. The breakfast was of a surprisingly good continental standard, and we stayed in a room with a lovely little roof terrace (43), which all added to the experience. All in all I'd thoroughly recommend the San Carlo. A very central, reasonably priced hotel with decent quality rooms and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, decent prices, BEST LOCATION!”
Reviews.Author: byoung3rd
Reviews.Content: We selected the San Carlo for its location and we were pleasantly surprised by how nice the hotel was. The staff were great, the food was fresh and plentiful, the rooms were lovely (they had just finished refurbishing)...but far and away the best feature is the location...you can just hang out on Via della Carrozze..lots of restaurants and bars...or go up to the Piazza di Spagna...the neighborhood is in the center of everything and it keeps going until late at night (but our room was quiet). I can't say enough about the area... Do yourself a favor and book your room here and you will experience Rome as you have never experienced it before.

Reviews.Title: “Not too shabby”
Reviews.Author: ItsColdUpHere
Reviews.Content: We picked the HOtel San Carlo because of its terrific location. Our room was very basic, but that was OK. We only spent time there when we were sleeping and showering. The hotel staff was terrific. They were kind enough to carry our extremely heavy suitcases up to our room for us. The same women always was at the front desk and made calls to our limo service, gave us directions, etc. We also liked that we were very close to a great shopping area. Would I stay here again? You bet. Just keep in mind, this is not an American hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly Noisy...”
Reviews.Author: freakyholiday
Reviews.Content: The location is nice if you want to be in the "Beverly Hills" shopping area...VERY touristy though...But most of central Rome is! The breakfast was basic rolls, sweat roll, cereal...Most breakfasts we had in Italy were nothing special and quite minimal compared to other countries in Europe... Our room was fairly good size but VERY run down...Cracked floor tiles...Chipped paint...Broken shower...Horrible uncomfortable mattress...But we ignored that thinking it was old Italian "charm"! Our main issue was the NOISE factor...We constantly heard room doors and a hotel entry doors slamming 24 hours a day...Also, I guess the windows are not dual paned/glazed...We could hear noise from the street below at ALL hours...motor cycles/scooters...people opening their stores at 6 AM!...Trash trucks banging at ALL hours...I've traveled to large cities hundreds of times (ie. NY,Paris,London,ETC...)and understand urban noise But this was not acceptable...On our 5th night we found an incredible room for less than half the price of San Carlo near Pzza Republica...Super clean/updated & quiet!...Also, the front desk workers are not very helpful at San Carlo even though we had a 5 night reservation...They of course brushed me off when I wanted a different room saying that nothing was available...And they were no help whatsoever for general information about Rome...

Reviews.Title: “Good for price & location, but be careful......”
Reviews.Author: Mike-Wiesner
Reviews.Content: I stayed here based on Tripadvisor reviews, so I insisted on a room on a lower floor. This was honored, but I made the mistake of getting a single room. These rooms are extemely small, like large closets, with beds much smaller than a twin. It was just passable, but for a larger person it would be impossible. The second thing is on both sides of each floor are staircases, and the sound of footsteps and voices can be heard in every room. Folks coming in late at night were not always quiet. Otherwise the staff were extremely friendly and helpful, the breakfast far better than a normal continental (if you go early or late to get a comfortable seat), and the location superb.

Reviews.Title: “Good.”
Reviews.Author: VGiyer
Reviews.Content: no elevators to carry luggage.. breakfast was ok, not great. but room was clean, good location close to spanish steps. people were not very helpful. if you get a good deal, go for it.! It is not bad

Reviews.Title: “Well located hotel, fair price for what you get in this expensive city”
Reviews.Author: smudge66
Reviews.Content: Hotel San Carlo is situated by the Spanish steps between the 2 of the main shopping streets (Via Condetti & El Corso) Ideally placed for loads of great restaurants, buses at the end of the street and the metro (grim). We were in the main hotel building and specified this on the booking. We had a top floor (4th) room that was really nice in fact there was a double bed and single bed in separate rooms within the room. There is no lift in the main building and the stairs were steep so this is not the hotel for you if you are not fit. One down side and it was minor is that the breakfast was limited, cake, cake and more cake! (Little in terms of savoury items). We would stay there again for the location, price and staff they were all very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: bengo4
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel after a friend's recommendation and following up w/reviews via Travelocity. Bathroom was newly renovated & spotless; room was clean & a good size. Terrace was nice but didn't have a view. Glass-enclosed shower was small but had both handheld & fixed showerheads, and even a pull-alarm for emergencies. Bring hair conditioner & a washcloth, because they aren't provided (shampoo, soap, hairdrier, handtowels & body towels are). Staff was friendly and responsive. No internet, but staff will direct you to an internet provider one block over (limited hours) or an internet cafe just one metro stop (or 10 min walk) away. After reading bad feedback here, I e-mailed to request a room in the main hotel rather than the annex, and they gladly complied. No elevator & narrow staircase, so pack light or request a lower floor (terrace is on the 4th [top] floor). Staff will of course carry your bags for you, regardless. No in-room safe--front desk has one. Staff is very responsive to e-mail & will hold luggage. Fantastic location but in general, be prepared to walk a lot and on uneven surfaces, because there are cobblestones all over Rome (and of course the ruins by the Colosseum) and metro stations are not always nearby. Would stay here again, no question. But for lack of internet & elevator, would give 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Hotel Snob 6715
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a good location, near the Spanish steps and Metro stop. There was a good restaurant just across the street as well. The staff was friendly, but there was no elevator. We got a room on the fourth floor and it was like climbing Mt. Everest. The poor bellman had to make 4 trips to bring us our luggage. The room was very small, so small there was literally no place to put a suitcase. The room was clean and quiet, and there was a nice breakfast in the morning. A decent value, but too small for my taste. However, we went to Sorrento and returned to the San Carlo for 1 night to await an early morning flight and were given a room in the annex. Well, this room was great. It was much bigger and had an elevator. The staff was wonderful and arranged transporation for us with no problem. If you are going on a sightseeing vacation and just want a clean and quiet place to sleep, this is fine for the price. It is definitely not a honeymoon destination.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings ...”
Reviews.Author: eskimo
Reviews.Content: This is a difficult review to write because I really want to be fair. We had booked this hotel following, at that time, generally positive reviews on Tripadvisor. No-one prior to my arrival had mentioned the annex round the corner from the main building so we were somewhat surprised to taken round there after checking in. Whilst the room in the annex was huge, the standard of the room was very poor in the extreme. The bathroom was filthy with mould, dampness and broken tiles predominating. The bedroom felt claustraophobic with the dark, beamed ceiling and it felt all very olde-worlde. The bed especially was ancient - the mattress had broken springs that popped up through the sheet. My husband, who has a bad back following spinal operations, ended up having to take blankets out of the wardrobe to line his side of the bed in order to make it halfway comfortable. Unfortunately he was still in agony the next day and unable to walk properly for weeks afterwards. When we complained the following morning, the lady on reception was quick to offer us another room in the main building. We packed our suitcases, which were brought over for us. Our new room was right at the top of the building, an 80-odd step climb. It was obviously brand new as there was a fresh paint smell and we spotted decorators in finishing off some of the other rooms leading to ours. This room was modern, much cleaner and most importantly, had a comfortable bed! We were much happier and would definitely recommend anyone booking this hotel to request a room in this section of the hotel. The location is truly fantastic, with the designer shops providing opportunities for brilliant window-shopping. The breakfast was poor, the worst we had during our entire holiday in Italy. Overall, I would stay here again but only if I could be assured of getting a room in the main building.

Reviews.Title: “Scots in San Carlo”
Reviews.Author: Happy-Haggis
Reviews.Content: We recently travelled from Edinburgh for a two night stay in the San Carlo. I had read numerous reports about the San Carlo on Trip Advisor and was slightly worried about the annex so we contacted the hotel (Victoria) by email to ask for a room in the main building, and she replied and arranged this for us. The location is perfect with so much life nearby, but still quiet enough to get a good sleep. Do ask for restaurant suggestions as they gave us a few to try. We ate in the 'Toto' restaurant across from the hotel which had excellent pasta but the steak was not such a good option. The room (41) was averge size for Rome, with good air conditioning and spotlessly clear. We even had our own private roof terrace with room for a sofa, two chairs and a dining table for six. Well worth requesting if you have a large party of people travelling together. Watch out for the stair though ... make sure you're fit enough for the 4 flights. The staff are happy to take your bags for you, so don't worry. Victoria on the front desk was a treasure, as she made us feel very welcome and even helped arrange other travellers to share a taxi to the airport when the metro was on strike. In fact, all the staff were very friendly and I could not fault any of them. We loved our stay here, and would return again. One tip for sight -seeing: tickets to the Colluseum also give you entrance to the Palatine Hill which we unfortunately did not notice till it was too late. We had visited the Colluseum when it started to rain and thought we could do the Hill the next day - which doesn't work as you have to do them both on the same day or pay twice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location- Needs Elevator!!”
Reviews.Author: RetiredTom
Reviews.Content: Great Location! We had a spacious, modern and newly renovated room on the third floor in the main building. It was a walk up. No elevator (one is being installed, they told us). Right down the street from the Spanish Steps and some great eateries. Continental breakfast was good- Loved their coffee!! Would stay there again when they get the elevator installed. Friendly english speaking staff.

Reviews.Title: “Can't be faulted for value and location”
Reviews.Author: JMB1867
Reviews.Content: I was a little concerned to read a couple of the recent reviews about this hotel, expecially from those who stayed in the annex. Fortunately my fretting about being allocated a room in the annex disappeared when we were given a room in the main hotel. Ok, it's a pain walking up the stairs at the end of the day, but unless you're old and infirm it's no biggie (the climb to the top of the Spanish steps down the road is worse!). The room was pretty much faultless. Looked out onto a courtyard onto which backed onto a bunch of shops, which meant no noise past about 8pm. Couldn't believe how quiet it was for the location. Room decor looked practically new, big double shower with screen, aircon. Was nice to head back for an hour or two before dinner after a day's walking round Rome and just chill for a bit. Breakfast was nothing to write home about - fresh croissants and bread rolls, cereal, then mainly pre-packed continental breakfast fayre (toast, cake etc). But I'd rather have it that way round than have a shoddy room and cracking breakfast. It was enough to set you up for the day, which is the main thing. Don't know what more people can expect for a hotel in this location, which personally I think is the best area to stay in Rome. Piazza di Spagna has a great atmosphere in the evening and there are plenty of restaurants, not to mention the shops, in the nearby vicinity. I expect the rooms differ in quality quite drastically, because I can't identify with some of the reviews of hard beds and cracked tiles etc that appear on this site. For what it's worth, ours was room 72 and the whole corridor looked fairly new so one would hope all the rooms (beginning 70-something and 80-something) are the same. For a short break in Rome my experience of this hotel was spot on.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Staff and Room”
Reviews.Author: sharonwishnew
Reviews.Content: The female concierge was a terrific help, here. she offered to try to find a taxi partner for me, she advised us well about when to visit the Vatican and she gave us a terrific recommendation for dinner (not expensive). The room was the "coolest " of all the place we stayed during our 2 week visit in July. Meaning it was equivalent to American air-conditioning. It was a wonderful location, and was relatively, inexpensive. The breakfast was just okay. Rolls, cheese and good coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location but no elevator!”
Reviews.Author: lanaia28
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in the heart of Rome. Excellent location near numerous restaurants and shopping. Rooms were clean we had 3 people and received a room with 2 bedrooms. The main turnoff is the fact that this hotel has no elevator and we stayed on the 4th floor!!!!!!!! This was definately a strain having to climb up and down 4 flights of stairs daily.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Gem256
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the San Carlo in July 2006. Our room was well decorated, spacious and clean with bathroom recently renovated and modern. The Location is perfect and walked to all sights without using public transport. The breakfast (typical Italian) was good and the staff serving it were friendly and helpful. The hotel is great value for money and highly recomment this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “We won't be back...”
Reviews.Author: ekerr19
Reviews.Content: Well, we sort of knew it going in, but the location and price were hard to beat - but not worth the aggravation. We got stuck with three rooms in the "other" building around the corner, two of the rooms were only up one flight of stairs (we weren't even told about the elevator) and our boys were on the 3rd floor. The tile floor in our room was filthy - and the shower was awful. As a few others noted, the breakfast was nothing to write home about either. There are too many other fine establishments in Rome - we won't waste our time here again. One of the things that bothered me the most (we were coming for one night, post-cruise) is that we arrived at about 1:00pm and were told to come back in 2 hours, the rooms weren't ready - all our stuff was just laying around in their very small lobby (along with everyone else's stuff) and unless we wanted to carry around laptops and camera bags, we had to trust that they'd be safe - at any rate, three times we came back and were told rooms were still not ready! By this point, it's about 5:00pm and the kids are tired, hot and hungry and want to relax a bit before dinner... When I finally got firm with the staff about the long wait, low and behold - suddenly they had rooms! We thought the delay at check-in was happening to just us, but it wasn't - a decent hotel would never leave guests waiting as long as we did to check in, but I see other reviewers wrote about getting the same excuse for delayed check-in that there were "unexpected late check-outs that morning" ... definitely not worth the hassle of it all.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Italianissima73
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the San Carlo for 2 nights in April 2006. It was my second time at the hotel (my first stay was in Nov 2002) and as usual I was not disappointed. Hands down it is in the best location in Rome, only blocks from the Spanish Steps and half a block from Via del Corso (fabulous shopping that won't leave you broke). You can walk everywhere from this hotel, the Colosseum, the Vatican or you can take the metro which is located only a few block away next to the Spanish Steps. The hotel itself is your typical European hotel. Our room this time was small but very clean and the bathroom was a good size. Our bed was made and bathroom cleaned when we came back to the room every afternoon. The room had a TV and the bathroon a hair dryer. During my first stay at the San Carlo in 2002 I was with a group of 40 people and the hotel staff was extremely helpful and accommodating to our groups needs. I found that this has not changed. We did not spend much time in our room so the smaller size really had no effect on us. The main building HAS NO ELEVATOR so those of you that cannot do stairs be sure to make that clear when making your reservation. We did not mind as the stairs helped us work off the amazing meals we had during our stay. For a romantic and delicious meal try Le Sorelle on Via Belsiana, 30 just around the corner from the hotel. A bit pricey but it was our anniversary dinner so we treated ourselved. The breakfast was just enough to prep you for your day, milk and cereal as well as yogurt, croissants, organge juice, tiny wrapped cakes that you could take with you for a snack later on and of course the yummy cappucino! The desk staff was very helpful in arranging for a taxi to take us to the bus station so we could continue our trip. I also arranged via e-mail for a driver to come and get us at the airport when we arrived - it was worth the 55 euro since we were exhausted. I think this is a great little hotel in a fantastic location, and if you go to Rome off season the hotel is riduclously inexpensive for the location. Buona Vacanza!!

Reviews.Title: “Cheated (see photos)”
Reviews.Author: JWS77
Reviews.Content: We booked hotel san carlo based on the good review on tripadvisor, and stayed there 8/9 and 8/10. Now I fully understand the previous "Beware" message. We were also put in "ANOTHER building of the hotel" that is supposed to "have BETTER rooms" than their main building. I took some photos to help those like myself who rely on tripadvisor for hotel choices. They speak a thousand words.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the San Carlo in Rome”
Reviews.Author: AdvGirl
Reviews.Content: After reading many of the reviews on this and other websites, we stayed at The San Carlo this past May for six days. The staff was excellent and very friendly. I read some grumblings about the limited breakfast, we did not experience this. And the cappucino just got better and better every day. We stayed in the Annex of the hotel on the 4th floor. Our room was large, there was a tub and shower (a must for me), and the (very) small balcony was a hit. The double-paned windows easily shut out the noise when needed and the room air conditioner worked great. In the Annex there is an elevator up to the 3rd floor. Walking up one flight was no big deal. We also booked a car to and from the airport through the hotel and they were on time, took us on a bit of a tour upon arrival, and were just nice folks. As you can see, I highly recommend the Hotel San Carlo and we'd definitely stay there again, just a few steps from the Spanish Steps.

Reviews.Title: “we liked it. family of 5”
Reviews.Author: tux03
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the san carlo for 7 nights, 2 rooms #43 for our 3 kids 15, 19, 23. it was ok. ac a little weak, great terrace. our room was the one on the web site #78. it was very clean nice terrace. great ac. the first 2 nights we selpt on a rock hard matrress, i wanted to cry. we asked the front desk about a pad and that morning they bought us a new bed. it was great. they couldn't have been nicer to all of us. we arranged transfers 55 eruo each way to fco, great price for a family of 5. the refridgerator was a life saver, they filled them with bottled water and it was no charge, also we went to the market and ate out on the terrace one night bread, cheese, fruit , saliami, ect. bottle of wine, and played cards. it was one of most memorable nights with are kids. we put the left over in the fridge. we went on a tour with the hotel to tuscany, with a private driver 13 hours it was wonderful. call the hotel, or email them they do speak english. watch your cab rides, go only with one that use the meter. we rode the buses, they were ok, but at night stick with the cabs. no one brother us ( pick pockets ect...) safe area. but don't put your guard dowm. we aranged a tour of ancientt rome on segways . it was a blast. we saw more then we could have imangined, and it was a hot day. so it was better then walking. good luck and have fun.

Reviews.Title: “Beware!”
Reviews.Author: KWF
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews on trip advisor before going so I was a little nervous because they were very inconsistent. Unfortunately, my worst fears were realized. My 18 year old son and I were traveling together on this trip. When we arrived at the San Carlo, they explained that our room was in the 'annex'. We walked down the street and around the corner to a small door which they explained we had to ring a bell to enter. Through a small hallway, into a two person elevator to the second floor, down a narrow hallway to our small room. There was no balcony in sight. I sat on the bed nearly in tears trying to figure out what bothered me. I realized it was because I felt completely unsafe. I talked to the night manger and he agreed to give us a room in the main building. The room was even smaller. The bathroom was tiny with a shower that was a hand held sprayer with no walls so everything in the bathroom was wet by the time you were finished. The air conditioner took an hour or more to cool down the room and dripped down the wall and onto the furniture all night. One of our single bed matresses had coils sticking out of it in three or four locations. The breakfast was barely adequate with most of it being prepackaged toast and cookies. The good news is the location. Just a block and a half from the Spainish Steps and the Via del Corso which came in handy the two nights it suddenly began to lightning and pour down rain. I would advise anyone who cares about creature comforts to beware. If like us, location is everything, you probably can't do better for the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Inconsistent at best, horrible at worst”
Reviews.Author: monkeylizard
Reviews.Content: Probably will not return to this one. Our fist night we checked in and they put us in a room that did not appear to have been used in some time, #57. The hotel owns three buildings and this one was not in the main hotel. It was out the front door and around a corner. Enter through a tiny ugly hallway and then up a two person elevator. One more flight of stairs from there. The bell man was in a hurry to drop off our bags and get out, and I can see why. I would describe it as a cross between a youth hostel and a Marine Corps barracks (I’ve slept in both), except a Corps barracks is always clean. Most deffinately NOT how it appears on the web site. My wife was in tears it was so bad. No other rooms available that night, but the next day they moved us to a room on the roof. Room #59 is a room built on top of the main hotel all by itself with a roof top garden terrace. It was MUCH better, but still not what the web makes it look like. I’d say the first night was like a Motel 2 (not even close to a Motel 6). The second room was comparable to a Super 8, but the terrace made it seem much nicer. The seclusion of the rooftop made us feel like the only ones in the hotel. The only catch to someone requesting Room 59 is that you have to go up 5 flights of stairs and THEN you have to go up a narrow wrought iron spiral staircase to the roof (they’ll handle the luggage). Anyone that’s completely out of shape or moderately overweight would have difficulty reaching this room. We had no problems with the stairs and I kind of liked it. This room could have been real nice, but we had that nagging suspicion about how clean things were, probably because of night 1's experinece. The grout and caulk in the bathroom for example had some small areas of black mildew in the corners. Little things like that. Nothing horrible in that room, but I wouldn’t give this hotel more than 3 stars at best, and 1 at worst. Stay at your own risk since it appears that the rooms are inconsistent from one to another, so you would just never know what you’d get. I would bet that the rooms in the main building are better (and generally acceptable) than in the other two. In all fairness, it sounds like most hotels in Rome that won't cost you your first born child are kind of a dump by other standards. The staff was excellent and helped out in any way they could. Breakfast was fine too, if a little monotonous. The location was great. Lots of restaurants and shops and close to Trevi fountain and a Metro stop. I just found it unacceptable for a hotel to have such wild variations from room to room and list them out at the same prices. My tip: Check in as early as possible to get a room in the main building. We checked in late the first night... Sighteeing sleeper: Go to the San Carlo cathedral. It's at the end of the street (1 block) and is beautiful. It wasn't in any of my guide books, mostly because it doesn't have any famous artist's work, but the building is great.

Reviews.Title: “Review of the San Carlo Hotel, Rome”
Reviews.Author: 1stgradeteacher
Reviews.Content: Our family of three stayed at the San Carlo Hotel for three nights after a Med. cruise this July. Triple rooms in Rome are not easy to find. We read the reviews on Tripadvisor and selected the San Carlo based on location and price. When we arrived we were told our room was not ready. We could leave our luggage and it would be brought to our room and we could check in later. We went and did some sightseeing and returned at 3 pm. We were shown to a room in the hotel's annex in another building around the corner from the main hotel. The room did indeed have three beds, but we had arranged for a superior triple and the room we were supposed to get had one double bed and a single bed in a separate area. We complained to the person who brought us over and he said, "Use the phone and speak to the hotel desk." At first the desk said that this is a triple room. When I persisted the story changed. We were overbooked by a wedding party that did not leave on time. We can change your room tororrow. We will give you a discount for tonight. (ie. charge me the correct rate for the room assigned - hardly a discount!). Our next room was in the main hotel. As you entered there was a short hallway. The bathroom was to the left, the single bed in a tiny room straight ahead and the double bed in a room to the right. Only the room with the double bed had an air conditioner. It could be turned on when you were in the room. The room key went in a slot in the wall. When the room key was removed, all the lights went out and the air conditioning stopped. Rome is very hot in July. We found that it took 2 to 3 hours for the room to get comfortable after our return from sightseeing. Our daughter, in the small single bed area, never did get cooled off. The air conditioning did not really travel that far. We fould the hotel adequate and spotless clean. However, it lacked charm. The location was great for shopping in the high end shopping area of Rome. When we return to Rome in December we will select another hotel in a slightly higher price range to get a better level of comfort and service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and Helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in an excellent location, close to many restaurants and sites, with the metro a short walk away. The staff was quite helpful and friendly. We had a nice, clean and spacious room on the top floor. Be prepared for the many flights of stairs up to your room; (I think there were 73??)....but well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location at a good price.”
Reviews.Author: blondeinabmw
Reviews.Content: I booked Hotel San Carlo based on reviews from this site. Located a short, inexpensive taxi ride from Termini, Hotel San Carlo is convenient to just about everywhere in Rome. We walked to Vatican City, the Forum and everywhere else in-between with ease. When we didn't want to walk, we would take the metro, which was right up the street. The hotel also provides a great map! The neighborhood around Hotel San Carlo is one of the nicest in Rome's Centro Storico. If you're shopping in Rome, this is where you'll do it. Most of the finest fashion in the world has a store front in this neighborhood. Clean streets, minimal grafitti and well-dressed pedestrians everywhere you turn. The piazza spagna is crawling with tourists after around 11 am every day, but it thinned out quite a lot by 8 pm at night. The staff greeted us upon arrival, stowed our bags and asked if we could return in an hour when our room would be ready. An hour later, we came back and the nice lady at the desk sprinted up the (85!) marble steps to our fourth floor room. I thought I was going to have a heart attack as I hoofed behind her, sucking wind the whole way! The steps are tough, but by the second day we'd pretty much gotten used to them. Our room was at the back of the building and faced a small interior courtyard of other residences. The room was small, but immaculately clean and offered sufficient storage for our bags so as to not cramp the room's minimal floor area. The bathroom was average-sized but included a very large shower. The only oddity was if the shower door was opened just a little bit and the bathroom door closed, a horrible odor would permeate the bathroom. It's the same odor I noticed throughout much of Rome - must be something in the city's sewer system. Kind of like a city-wide sour drain. At night, the courtyard was very quiet, even with the shutters and windows open. The breakfasts at Hotel San Carlo were terrible. Aside from the complimentary large San Pelligrino bottles offered, little else was edible. The brioche was awful. The croissants tasted like they were several days old. Even the packaged pastries were terrible. Dry, bland and wholly unappetizing. The breakfast area is well appointed - it's just a shame the food served within is so dreadful. By far the worst breakfast spread we encountered of all our hotels in Italy. Alas, there is a welcome pair of golden arches just down the street that provides much more palatable fare. We did eat at three restaurants on the hotel's recommended list with much better results. Make reservations in advance if you want to get into any of them on their list, though! At checkout, the desk man gave us a discount for paying in cash. That made for an even better deal. Don't stay in Hotel San Carlo for the food. Stay for the excellent location at a good price. If I return to Rome, I would consider staying here again. If budget is a concern, this is certainly a reliable bargain in what can be a very expensive city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and accommodations – good value!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel San Carlo was very nice and had a great location near the Spanish Steps. We stayed in the annex building of the hotel on the top floor, which was great. Quiet, with a nice bathroom, and cute balcony! Good value!!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed stay at Hotel San Carlo”
Reviews.Author: nolesgirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel San Carlo May 13 thru May 16 and were very pleased with the hotel. We found the staff very fluent in English and did not have a problem communicating. The breakfast was very sufficient and satisfying. The location was very central and we basically walked everywhere. Would stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good All Around Value”
Reviews.Author: MaggeeB
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel San Carlo from May 6th through the 9th. While they did not have the rooms available for us that we booked way back in February due, they said to a wedding party that did not leave, they did move our traveling companions the 2nd day into the appropriate room. They did try to put us into an auxilary building that was down around a corner. that I would not stay in. It was a door that opened to the street, with no desk, you rang a buzzer that would be answered by the front desk in the main hotel... the only security was a camera hanging in the narrow hallway. I would not have felt safe staying there even with my 200+ pound husband with me. I recommend that everyone require that they put you up in the MAIN hotel. The hotel was clean, the staff nice, not fluent in English so be aware that you will need to make yourself very clear, and the breakfasts were more than adequate for us with coffee, cappacino, expresso, teas, fresh [best we ever had] croissants, rolls, and assorted breads, etc. We were off sightseeing each morning with the tours they booked so it was stuff we could grab and go. I would stay at the Hotel San Carlo again, it lived up to its photos, gave good value for the dollar considering it is in Rome and everything is pricey, and its location was wonderful! We could walk to the Spanish Steps in under 5 minutes and there were lots of shopping and restaurants all around us. All in all I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Hotel San Carlo based on positive reviews on this site. We were not disappointed. The hotel is on a charming little street, close to just about everything you might want to walk to in central Rome, was not expensive for the area (near Spanish steps), and had a lovely little room. The staff was exceedingly friendly, offering us help with everything from directions to the catacombs to looking up museum hours to reserving a taxi to the airport. Our room was small but immaculate, with a wonderful balcony overlooking the street. The only downside that I could mention would be the lack of elevators in the building (really wasn't too bad though and helped to burn off all the calories we consumed). We would highly recommend this hotel and would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: SFSolo
Reviews.Content: A good choice if you are looking for a moderately priced hotel near many immoderately priced shops. The San Carlo is very convenient to the Spanish Steps and also close enough to be able to reach the Centro Storico or Piazza del Popolo easily. However, unless you feel like a stretch, use a cab, the metro or bus to visit the Vatican, Trastevere or the Colosseum. The hotel itself is very accommodating, clean and attractive, competently managed and courteously staffed. It is nicely furnished, immaculately clean and tastefully decorated. To avoid disappointment, always remember that the "fourth floor" in Italy is the fifth floor in the USA and there is no lift (to be fair, they warn you of that fact in advance). My single room, on the "fourth" floor, was perfectly fine. Although it was miniscule even by Roman standards, the size was balanced by a private terrace, which was a nice surprise. The bathroom, meanwhile, made the main room look large by comparison, but it too was perfectly clean and serviceable. Breakfast was unremarkable (i.e., typical Roman -- coffee, juice, yogurt and rolls) but the staff serving it were friendly and helpful. The "breakfast room" (mostly just comprising the area behind the reception counter)was not unpleasant, but did not offer adequate seating for the number of guests. I think they also call this a "bar" at night, but I saw no evidence of it. Above all, in any case, compliments to the front-desk staff for exemplary work. Overall, a good solution if you want a nice place to sleep but would rather spend your money at Gucci.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Sue-Stokie
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel mainly because of the central location & it could not be easier to find - the road is literally straight opposite the exit from Spagna station. We had booked a standard double room & were expecting it to be small. However, we were given a huge triple room with a terrace. The rooms are elegantly decorated & very clean. Bathrooms are small but functional. Breakfast was not lavish but adequate (no hot food)& excellent coffee. The staff were friendly & helpful. The only reason I have not given the San Carlo five stars is that we were woken up twice by very loud building work (the room below ours was being converted)at 8am (the second time on Valentine's Day - v. romantic!) However, it did not happen again after we complained & we were given a discount on checkout without having to ask. Overall, I would thoroughly recommend the San Carlo. It is in a great area, with lots of nice restaurants, cafes & bars nearby, as well as some of the smartest shopping streets in Rome if you want to give your plastic a workout! Rome, of course, was as magical as ever & all the sights can be reached on foot from the San Carlo.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth all the glowing reviews”
Reviews.Author: IrishOllie
Reviews.Content: When planning our trip to Rome I made sure to book our hotel only after I had read it's reviews on Tripadvisor. The hotel I finally decided on was the San Carlo. The reviews given to it on the web were glowing and I felt sure that it was the ideal choice even though it was slightly more expensive than other hotels I had looked at. Having stayed there for 4 nights I will agree that the location is great. It is very close to the metro station and it is surrounded by a great choice of restaurants. However, this is the hotel's best feature. The level of service is fine but nothing to write home about. There are alot of steps to the rooms on higher floors (85 to ours) and no facilities to get a hot drink after breakfast time (our visit took place in January). The hotel was clean and the staff who service the rooms do a fantastic job. Had I not read the reviews before we visited I would have been quite satisfied with the San Carlo but I had built myself up to expect more. This was a mistake. Adequate, clean and centrally located would be my description.

Reviews.Title: “great family room at San Carlo”
Reviews.Author: ldb61
Reviews.Content: June 2005 Room #77- 4 nights. First family vacation in Rome (parents,11 and 12 year old)quad room with large balcony, single beds in upstairs loft, comfortable double bed in main room. Air conditioning was perfect during extremely hot weather and small refrigerator was very useful. We enjoyed everything about the hotel, even the very long walk up to the room! it was great exercise and our kids liked the challenge to reach the top long before their parents. Location was excellent and walked to all sights, never used public tranit. Used the hotel car service from the airport, a delightful man met us at the airport! We thought the breakfast was more than adequate. The rooms were very clean and bathrooms recently renovated and modern. A great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mwalshe
Reviews.Content: Stayed a weekend here in early January 2006. Great hotel, both single and double rooms good size, great location for shopping, eating and sightseeing, great staff, helpful and welcoming. The only slight issue is that you need to be able to climb stairs, no lift, but this is a very minor detail!

Reviews.Title: “Wow! What a GREAT Place!!”
Reviews.Author: tcgirlie
Reviews.Content: Hotel San Carlo, hands down, is one of the best hotels I've stayed at in Europe. I'm a fairly seasoned European traveler and have stayed in my fair share of NASTY places. Hotel San Carlo was a clean, classy place with comfy beds. We the San Carlo in early September '05. We arranged for a driver to pick us up at the airport (wise investment of 50 euros). He was great! Kinda shy, which, when paired with my family, doesn't mix! So, I'm sure we aggravated him to death, but he was such a good sport!! (Sorry can't remember his name!) He was kind enough to take us on a driving tour of the city before dropping us off at the hotel. We had no idea at the time, but once we had become more familiar with the city, it was obvious he had gone out of his way to show us and explain the sites. Wonderful! Actually, the best shot I got of the Colisseum was hanging out of the window of his Mercedes!! Super friendly, and, to all the ladies...very cute! Haha. Again, well worth the money. 50 euros may sound like a lot, but Roman cab drivers (well, Italian in general) will do a number on you. Plus, we had no idea where we were going, and after two minutes on the road, we quickly realize that we would have never survived driving in Rome!! The hotel is perfectly located. I know everyone says that about their favorite places, but really--PERFECT!!! We wanted to stay in centro storico, and hotels do not come cheap here. I happened to stumble on the San Carlo, read the reviews, and decided to go with it. Couldn't have made a better choice!! I think you could group my family with likes of many other travelers--once you pay the grand sum for the flight over, you don't have the luxury of forking over $300 a night for a hotel! San Carlo was a great value in a perfect spot with a fabulous staff. Literally, 5 minutes from the Spanish steps and the Metro stop. We were able to walk everywhere we wanted to go, granted, some were hefty walks. The hotel is situated in an area with lots of fun shops and little cafes. There's a great cafe a block away with fantastic gelato and a killer cappucino. Also, about two doors down from hotel is a cute wine and pastry shop (La Peonia). I'm a wine lover, so I had a great time talking with the shop clerk and selecting bottles of wine to take home. For the ladies, on the same block is a fantastic jewelry and accessories shop. Definitely ask for recommendations for dinner!! Not once were we disappointed! Fabulous food at affordable prices, all within walking distance of the hotel. We had a triple room and I was so impressed with the size! Couldn't believe it! Plus, there was air conditioning! What a plus! Breakfast was great. Croissants, muffins, yogurt, pastries, those Italian donuts that make your mouth water, and the best cup of coffee I had the whole time I was in Rome. Bottom line, and excellent value for a gem of a hotel. Oh, and a tip--if you speak Italian or know someone that does, give them a call. We got 15 euros knocked off the normal reservation price by calling.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous value- great location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on our honeymoon in the middle of December. First, the location is stellar. It's about 3 blocks from the Spanish Steps (and Metro stop), in the middle of the premium shopping district. There are many restaurants, cafes, shops, churches and monuments in every direction within easy walking distance. After returning to the hotel to rest from a long day of sight-seeing, we loved taking night strolls and seeing the Christmas lights and all the shopping hustle and bustle. The hotel itself was wonderful- I believe our room was upgraded (from a double standard to a room with a loft and semi-private balcony- room 78) because we were on our honeymoon. We were in the main building, and on the top floor (with no elevator, which was rough after climbing to the cupola of St. Peter's), but our room was great! It was warm and dry during our stay in the cold, rainy weather. I was pleasantly surprised by the size of both the room and the bathroom, which was clean and elegant. The breakfast of pastries and cereal was all we really needed to not be weighed down as we began our long, full days. We did not find it too crowded, but we ate pretty early. Another reviewer mentioned it was hard to find a taxi to navigate the streets- we did not have this problem as a cab picked us up on the corner directly in front of the hotel. The staff was superb, knowledgable and friendly, and we would not hesitate to stay here again and again, or recommend all our friends to do the same.

Reviews.Title: “IMMACULATE HOTEL IN GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the San Carlo 15th-18th Dec 2005 for our wedding anniversary and could not have picked a better hotel. The location is ideal with no need for taxis, 2 mins walk from the Spanish Steps, 10 mins to the Trevi Fountain and 20 mins to the Colosseum and Vatican. We both travel extensively for work and this is one of the cleanest hotels we have stayed in. Standard rooms are average size but very functional with good facilities. We would recommend staying in the main hotel building and although we were on the 4th floor didn't mind the walk up the stairs (no lift)as this allowed us to have a balcony. Small breakfast room with basic continental breakfast (great coffee) but more than adequate. Suggest using hotel driver (John) for airport transfers. Would also contact Victoria at the hotel for rates as they matched best internet deals.

Reviews.Title: “Short break”
Reviews.Author: Gis001
Reviews.Content: Our first stay at San Carlo, chose this hotel because we wanted to be specifically in this area. We were allocated on the top floor of the annex, and although very basic, the rooms were warm, spacious and clean. Lift available to the 4th floor and steep and narrow stairwell was uncomfortable to manage. Hotel should inform the clients in advance about this arrangement (or perhaps we should have read the other reviews thoroughly!). Breakfast was practically non existent, considering the high price for the room (E260 for a twin for 2 nts). Since we are frequent visitors to the area, we know that this is what you get unless you are willing to pay 3 times as much and go for the boutique 5 star hotel round the corner.

Reviews.Title: “A great find”
Reviews.Author: avenger41080
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights in December. I'd read other reviews before I went and was aware that many people's experiences differed greatly depending on the room. All I can say is that I was pleasently surprised. We were given room 77 - it's quite a climb but well worth it for a great split-level room with private terrace. The staff were friendly and helpful and I'd definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: clarabow35
Reviews.Content: A group of eight friends stayed at the San Carlo on 2nd Dec for 3 nights. My husband and myself were in the annexe as we had booked a superior room (115 euros a night). The room was quite spacious by Italian standards with a large bathroom with a tub that was much appreciated after all day walking. The mini fridge was a bonus to keep the drinks cool too. Some of our friends were in the hotel itself and they had the standard rooms (100 euros a night) which I thought were a bit sparse and bland with only a shower, it's worth paying the extra. They do not have a bar only a breakfast room but there are some great little bars locally. The staff are all very friendly and helpful and if you want a decent room in a great location at a reasonable price you won't go far wrong with The San Carlo.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: dmgehring
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here with our six year old daughter Nov. 17-22. We had a double room in the annex. They put a cot in the room and we still had plenty of space. The room itself was lovely. We especially appreciated the elevator in the annex. The main hotel does not have this option. The last night of our stay we were moved into the main hotel (4th floor). We counted 73 steps to our door. We are both fairly young and in very good shape but it was still awful. The best thing about this hotel is the location. It is right off the Spanish Steps on a lovely street.

Reviews.Title: “Location! Location! Location!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed in the Hotel San Carlo the last 2 nights of our trip in Italy. It was right in the heart of the sights, restraunts, shopping. Upscale shopping to be exact!! We just loved it and it was very beautiful. The rooms were amazing with the most comfortable beds and comforters! The price was unbelievable for the location. The only problem was, of course, no elevators. We were on the 5th floor and had to walk upstairs. After touring for over a week, we were pretty used to steps though! The staff was wonderful and very helpful! I would highly recommend this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: clarshan
Reviews.Content: Just spent 4 night's in Rome, a beautiful city and the Hotel San Carlo was what we expected after having read the reviews. The staff are friendly and welcoming and the room we were allocated in the annex was v. good. We were wary at first as I had heard good reports about the hotel and wanted to stay in it but we neednt have worried the annex was fine. However a warning to travellers Rome is very dangerous regarding pickpockets, we travelled on the metro and whilst it is a great mode of transport on the second day on our way to the Vatican we were pickpocketed and lost several credit cards and a lot of cash. We had only travelled the length of one stop and were hardly on the train 5 minutes when the wallet was missed. The staff on the metro were helpful but trying to get someone speaking english to direct us to the police station was difficult. At the police station we met a man from Nottingham who had just arrived and lost his wallet the same way out of a pocket that had a zipper, on the plane home we met a young man who was there in a group of 6, his sister had her handbag cut and snatched out on the street. My advice to anyone in Rome for only a short time who wants to see the sights is to go on the open top tour buses as they stop at all the major sights and you can hop on and off all day for €13 per person, a bit more expensive than the €11 3 day metro ticket but much safer. Rome is a very historical and beautiful place so enjoy your trip but just be cautious.

Reviews.Title: “Good, friendly little hotel”
Reviews.Author: ddarlow
Reviews.Content: The San Carlo is well located, in the midst of the premier shopping area of the city - very atmospheric little streets with pavement cafes etc. St Peters, the Pantheon, Spanish Steps, all within walking distance, but the rest a taxi-ride. Our room was good, if a little spartan - I'd asked for a triple, and got a 2 room suite, which was great. The staff were helpful and friendly, but the biggest drawback in the hotel comes at breakfast time. Some 50 or more guests try to eat in a tiny space with only nine small tables. People are forced to hop around waiting for someone to finish up, which is displeasing to everyone. Actually, it is probably better to give up because the breakfast itself is poor - all sweet, even the croissants. Outside, another drawback: It is almost impossible to get a taxi to negotiate the one-way system to find the hotel. You are invariably dropped near the Spanish Steps and have to carry your luggage about 3 blocks. Similarly, when ordering a taxi it arrives with the meter already sprinting, so the smallest ride costs a fortune. Nevertheless, the San Carlo is good value for money, well-positioned, and I might well choose it again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Room but no Elevator”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel in San Carlo Rome for 2 nights on our honeymoon and the hotel was very nice and our room large with a very large bathroom for Italian standards. The staff was very pleasant and helpful. The location was great with being maybe 50 yards from the Spanish Steps and a good walk to all of the sights and shopping (for my wife). Breakfast was normal, nothing spectacular, but enough to get you started for your day. I would not recommend having a rental car as we did, as the hotel is in an area very difficult to get to by car. You actually have to park at a garage and get a taxi to the hotel if you have alot of luggage. Also, alot of steps to get to the room, we are young so it did not bother us, but just a caution to those who may not be able to climb stairs. Overall, I would recommend and definitely stay there again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Curb appeal but room wasn't ready”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The San Carlo is on a quiet pedestrian street near the fashionable shopping, fine restaurants and tourist buzz of the Piazza Espana. And it fits right in with the posh storefronts in the neighborhood. I wish staying there had been easier. When we arrived in the late afternoon, the desk clerk reported that our room wasn't ready because of a delay regarding the room's previous occupants. The story was a bit convoluted -- they'd checked out but had left their bags and were overdue to pick them up, thereby delaying cleaning of the rooms. He said we could either come back in an hour, when the room would likely be ready, or he would offer us a discount to stay at a charming apartment a few blocks away. Another guest had done the same a few nights earlier and loved it. My wife and I probably should have chosen Option 1, but we were tired from traveling so we chose option 2, which turned out to be more like 5 blocks away. It was a very simple, slightly drably lit apartment on a considerably less charming street. Bathroom was acceptable, but overall, the place was not a bargain, even at the slight discount off the reasonably priced San Carlo. We came to expect that the sales job for this change indicated that the San Carlo was overbooked for the night and seeking a guest who wouldn't throw a fit over accepting alternative lodgings. My recommendation: check back and confirm that the San Carlo will indeed have a room for you. It'll probably be a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: luvroma2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the San Carlo for four nights, October 10 - 14, in room 49 on the 5th floor. It had the most wonderful, large terrace - I felt like I was living in Rome. This is a triple room (for which we paid the double price). We were given this room because we had requested a room with a balcony and this was the only one left. The room was nice sized, clean and had a modern bathroom. The location could not be better - you can walk everywhere. The Spanish steps, via Condotti and numerous restaurants are a few minutes' walk away. The staff is friendly and helpful. The climb up five flights of steps can be difficult after a day of walking and sight seeing, but I look at it as more calories burned so I can eat more delicious Italian food!! The breakfast, which is a typical Continental breakfast, is fresh and tasty. I have been told an elevator will be installed in the main hotel by early 2006. There is already one in the annex - where I stayed (and enjoyed) previously. It was also mentioned that with the new elevator there will be an increase in prices. This is the second time I have stayed here. I have recommended the San Carlo to other people who have booked rooms and will be staying here myself in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Mature traveller48
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the San Carlo Hotel for 3 nights. Knew that there was no elevator, so e-mailed hotel with request for room on lower floor, which was offered, and accepted by us on arrival. Very good location, room was of a reasonable size, but no bath, just shower. Staff were helpful with our requests for information, and we could not fault the service. Only minor drawback, delivery drivers were quite noisy in the early morning, might affect light sleepers! Would stay in the San Carlo again if in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but no elevator”
Reviews.Author: LAGuy90019
Reviews.Content: As others have written, I would give this hotel excellent if it weren't for the stairs. The hotel does not have an elevator but I was told they are going to put one in. I was given a large room that was recently remodelled. The accomodations for the price were great. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel is close to the Spanish Steps close to shopping and a 10 minute walk to many of the sites. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “room 71- cardio work out”
Reviews.Author: FauxJo
Reviews.Content: According to reviews on this sight we requested room 59 or a room in the annex-but specifically a room with a balcony. When we arrived we were told that they had given all balcony rooms away but that they would compinsate with giving us room 71. This room was IMPECCABLY SPOTLESS; White marble floors, pristine white walls, new wood furniture with glass tops, a small bar fridge, desk and TV. The bathroom had marble walls, a new shower, a blowdryer and all the ammenities.
