It was a great room in a great location...HOWEVER...the HIKE up to the room --4 floors=8 sets of stairs really was a bummer. My husband and I are young and healthy so we were not too concered about the climb at first but we found out quickly that after a full day of walking to see the sights in Rome, the climb absolutely knocked you out in the end. We ended up carrying all of our purchases all day to avoid the climb up to our room,and the 4 AM check out to catch our flight left us carting our heavy luggage down the 8 sets of steps (lifting them the whole way to cut down the noise made on the marble steps). Also taxis and tour busses cannot go down the skinny road in front of the building, so be prepared to carry your luggage a few blocks to get to the hotel. All in all, we would return but we would REFUSE to stay on any level higher then the second floor. (And we would pack LIGHT!)

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: TravelBear12
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel Sept. 23 - 26, 2005, and overall had a nice time. Here's a breakdown of our stay: LOCATION: The hotel is only a couple minutes walk from the Spanish Steps and close to the Borghese Gallery, on the north end of Rome. Trevi fountain is about a 10-15 minute walk away, Pantheon is a 20 minutes walk away, Vatican is 25-30 minutes walk aways and ancient Rome is a 35-40 minute walk away. One really nice thing about this hotel is there are several nice outdoor cafes and restaurants within a five-minute walk. We liked the location, though it may have nicer to be a little closer to central Rome, perhaps near the Pantheon. But can't complain too much -- you can walk pretty much everywhere from here! ROOM: We stayed in room 44 on the top floor of this hotel. The room was pretty basic, but clean. We had a triple, and unlike other Italian hotels we stayed in, this one gave us a separate bedroom for the third person. That was really nice. The bathroom was clean and fairly modern, with a bathtub and sliding shower bar, and bidet. There was a minibar and TV, but no safe. PRICE: We paid 198 euros a night for a triple. BREAKFAST: It was a basic breakfast with croissants and jam, cereal, yogurt, juice and choice of caffe. STAFF: The staff was helpful when we asked, though not overly accommodating. They did let us check out several hours early, since we were catching a 4 a.m. taxi to the airport. They arranged the taxi for us, which cost 55 euros. Someone also brought our bags up to our fourth-floor room for us, which was nice considering there's no elevator. ** A couple small gripes: Since our room was on the fourth floor, it meant we were stuck climbing four flights of stairs after every long day of sightseeing. It was manageable for us, but it got tiring. Also, there was a computer set up for guests to surf the Internet, but it only worked one of the four times we tried to use it. Overall, it's a decent hotel with a nice location. We would probably return, though we may look for something closer to central Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs Up for San Carlo”
Reviews.Author: mij
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 2 nights at the Hotel San Carlo in early September 2005 and would recommend it on the basis that you are only using the hotel as a base for sleeping and a shower after touring around all day. We stayed in the main part, not the "annexe" that some reviewers spoke of. Our main criteria for hotels on our holiday was location, cleanliness and a comfortable bed. The San Carlo gets a tick on all these. POSITIVES: Great location near the Spanish Steps, shopping district and metro station. Very clean. Friendly and helpful staff. Good standard continental breakfast (good filtered coffee and fresh croissants) included in the rate. NEGATIVES: Tiny bathroom and shower, but manageable. If you're six foot three or overly soild you may struggle. Water temperature control was a bit temperamental. No lift.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be in a better location!”
Reviews.Author: willowcrown
Reviews.Content: The only reason I'm not giving this hotel an "excellent" rating is due to the stairs. They really, really need to get a working lift in this hotel. It seems as though there is one there, but it is not operational. We were on the fourth floor of the main building. Our room was nice, spacious and clean. The stairs are a big issue because by the end of the day, you are so totally whipped that climbing 75 stairs seems insurmountable. The breakfast area is pleasant enough and the items offered were fine. It would be nice to vary the breakfast offerings a bit -- we were really bored with it by day three. The internet offering is terrific! It saved us on phone calls and we could do our banking right there, so we didn't have to bring so much cash around with us -- we did a good deal of transferring from account to account. One thing though...they need to find a different spot to put the computer. They've got it jammed into a little corner at the base of the stairs that everyone uses to go up and down. You really feel like you're in the way...especially if anyone is carrying something. Overall, I thought the hotel was an excellent value and would surely recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A Big Yes”
Reviews.Author: pace_dello_spirito
Reviews.Content: The staff was gracious and accommodating. Room was small but it's Rome! It was immaculate and we had a gorgeous outdoor balcony with comfy wicker furniture. The breakfasts were close and cozy which allowed us to meet other guests and make a few lasting friendships. They also had a computer in the breakfast area which was really convenient. I cannot remember the room number but i know it was on the 4th floor. (41 ir 42?) Staff also recommended two great restaurants in the area. Easy walking distance to EVERYTHING!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Positive experience, but no elevator”
Reviews.Author: MarkSSS
Reviews.Content: My wife and I liked this place a lot. Very large rooms by Italian standards, and a great location on a quiet street right by the Spanish Steps. We would stay here again. We paid 100euro per night. The one downside is that there are a lot of stairs and no elevator, so if that's a problem, take it into account. We are 25 so it was no big deal. The breakfast was fine and the staff friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Price”
Reviews.Author: Luckystrikes
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a hotel in Rome which offers great value for money and is in a top location in the centre and close to all of the attractions, then look no further! We were delighted with our stay here which was for two nights at the end of August. On arrival at the hotel, the friendly porter spied us coming down the street with our luggage, and came and took it straight to our rooms. The staff on the desk were always polite and helpful as were the breakfast staff. Our room was on the fourth floor, and is there is no lift, it gave us a chance to burn off some calories after eating so much nice food in this city. If you do not like too many stairs, then I would request either a room on the 1st or 2nd floors, or one in the annexes. Our room was spacious and very clean, and looked quite new which was nice. It was decorated in a modern style and had a lovely bathroom, with the room offering a view out to the back of the hotel over the Versace courtyard. Breakfast was fine, offering the usual continental offerings, and there was a mini-bar should you need anything in the room. The only thing I think that improve the hotel would be safety boxes in each room. I think there are boxes available down at reception, but I would prefer to have one in my room to put stuff in. This did not put me off the hotel however, and I will definitely use this hotel the next time I stay in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great value!”
Reviews.Author: Travelah
Reviews.Content: Wow! What a pleasant surprise. This place is great. We arrived at 11 am and were met by Victoria at the reception desk. I had emailed her a few weeks in advance to confirm and had requested room 57. She told me that that room was taken, but she would find me one just as nice. When I told her my name, she remembered me! She said that she wanted me to check out room 56 in the Annex building (I requested the Annex for the elevator). She said the room was ready! What a relief after traveling all night. So, she walked us to the our room and asked us if we approved. It was a small room with a comfortable bed, a balcony and a nice clean bathroom. Good enough for us. The included continental breakfast was super! We got there around 7:30 am and it wasn't crowded. The granola was fantastic and the pastries were Yum. It was classic continental breakfast--yogurt, cereal, juice, pastries, etc. Location: It was 3 minutes walk to the metro and the Spanish Steps--about 10 minutes to Trevi Fountain. Great location! One street over from Via Condotti (the shopping mecca). Would def stay again! We paid 125 euros. I think it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and very quaint bed & breakfast”
Reviews.Author: lillie32940
Reviews.Content: Our room was a little small (room 36) but our daughters had there own room and it was a regular size. The staff was very polite and very helpful in everything we needed. The girl that works the front desk was so kind to us. The location you can not beat it is close to the Spanish Steps down a little side street and close to the main street for shopping. Plenty of good restaurants in the area within walking distance. Breakfast could be a little better due to the fact we were there for 6 days you would like a little more or a variety. Overall I would recommend this hotel and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Annexe at San Carlo”
Reviews.Author: Strawsie
Reviews.Content: We have recently stayed at the Hotel San Carlo in Rome (Aug. 12th & 13th). Although I had booked on line (one month in advance) when we got to the hotel our booking was not in place. At first we were shown to a small room in the main building - I had been advised to book in the Annexe which I did and the booking had been confirmed by e.mail. However, Victoria soon sorted things out and we were shown to a lovely large room (no. 54) in the Annexe (Via Belsania) just around the corner from the main hotel building. The room had great character, a spotlessly clean all white bathroom and the lovely cool interior was most welcoming. The air-conditioning worked perfectly as did all the electricity in the room. The porter was a charming man who always had a smile and the staff in the breakfast rooms were always courteous and nothing was too much trouble for them. Our check in and check went smoothly. We had a 4.00 a.m. departure from the hotel and the reception desk ordered a taxi for us and even offered to collect our heavy suitcases from the room the night before. Just a word of advice: I would recommend staying in the Annexe. The website talks about balconies but they appear to be small and hardly worthwhile. Room 54 is apparently one of the larger rooms in the Annexe. The hotel is so well situated for shopping and sight seeing. We ate twice in two days at a wonderful Enoteca close by called Palatium but there are many small and good restaurants in the vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “San Carlo was a Great Find”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Italy and the Hotel San Carlo was the best place we've stayed in Rome. We did not consider it overpriced for what we got: a triple superior room with private terrace. The beds were comfortable, and the shower was better than my shower at home. The front desk staff could not have been friendlier, helping us arrange transportation, etc., and the porter who helped us with our suitcases always had a smile on his face. The breakfast staff were courteous and prompt, and there was one computer available with free internet access (on a first come first served basis, but the other guests were thoughtful about not monopolizing it if someone was waiting.) The only surprise came when my brother arrived a few days after we did, and it turned out his room was in an entirely different building half a block away, so that limited our ability to visit with each other. Had we known, we would have booked both rooms in the main building. The hotel's location was great for us, as we enjoyed walking up the Spanish steps to Borghese Park almost daily. We will definitely be back to the San Carlo next time we visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice”
Reviews.Author: ChristineNYC
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a perfect choice for us! Great location - we actually were able to walk to most of the major attractions. It was on a quiet small street near lots of restaurants and stores. The room we stayed in was gorgeous! I have a feeling they are trying to upgrade this hotel from a two star to a four because it looked like they were upgrading some rooms while we were there (ours was already done- we were in Room 76). The breakfast had the best cappuccino I've had in a long time. The front desk staff was very helpful and accomodating. The only downside was the hike up four flights of stairs to get to our room, but it looked like they may be working on an elevator.... This place gets two huge thumbs up! I can't believe we only paid 100 Euros a night for it!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Nel-PA
Reviews.Content: My family of 5 booked a double and triple at the San Carlo for three nights in June based on info on this site. It was an excellent choice. Our rooms were spacious and sparkling clean. All bath fixtures were like new. It was extremely quiet and the air conditioning worked great. Best of all, was the location. It's in a wonderful section of shops and restaurants yet the streets are small with very little traffic. Very charming area near the Spanish Steps and metro. The staff was very accomodating and helpful with restaurant reccomendations etc. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem in Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel San Carlo for our last 4 days in Italy and we still can't believe how fortunate we were to pick such a wonderful hotel. It is a hotel we only dreamed about: great location, great price, and very modern and new. Location: The Hotel San Carlo is located 2 short blocks from the Spanish Steps right in the heart of the best shopping in Rome. In fact, the entrance is in the Versace courtyard! All the major sites in Rome are within a 20 minute walk. Hotel and room: When we checked in at the front desk, a hotel staff member told us that we would be staying in their new Annex and led us down the street and around the corner to a private entrance leading into the Versace courtyard which had a staircase and an elevator. The hotel is on the 3rd floor with offices on the other floors. When we got off the elevator, there was a small office to our left where a hotel staff member was 24/7 and had security cameras of the hotel, stairs, hallway and entrance way. We always felt very safe througout our stay. As we walked down the hallway to our room, the lights got brighter (on sensors). Once inside our room, the air conditioning went on (also on sensors). We could tell that new hardwood floors were put in and that it was freshly painted. Everything was modern and new! The bed was a true king size (not two double beds pushed together) and the room had built in cabinets and the closet had shelves and drawers built in. The design was very simple in creams and beige. The bathroom was also modern with a marble floor, pedestal sink, bidet, and shower with sliding doors (rare in Italy). The towels were white and very large and plush. Breakfast: breakfast is in the main hotel around the corner and was ok. Not great. They had croissonts, pound cake, and cereal. I asked for a cappuccio and was told it was not working. They did have coffee but it wasn't good. We didn't stay in the main hotel and highly recommend the Annex part that we stayed in. It was very modern, new, in a great location and with the private entrance, we felt that we lived in Rome and were returning to our apartment.

Reviews.Title: “Okay stay”
Reviews.Author: advgal
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights (07/11/05). We paid $130 euros for this room. Luckily, this was our first hotel in Italy we visited so we could not compare it to any other hotels. The staff was helpful and kind. Our room (#36) was an average European room. It was a small room with a double bed and small restroom. The linens could have been cleaner. The restroom was acceptable. While showering, the shower head came off and the shower door broke at the same time. The staff fixed the shower head immediately, but the door was not able to be fixed. The hotel served typical Italian breakfast. After staying at many other hotels in Italy, the breakfast at Hotel San Carlo could improve their selection. Climb all the way to the top of the hotel for a nice sitting area on top. There is a pretty view up there. The hotel is in a convenient location. Just minutes from the Spanish Steps and subway station. Overall, it was an okay hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tcyaya
Reviews.Content: Rome was fabulous and this hotel was in a great location. We walked to everything with the exception of the colosseum (although we did walk back). We had room 77 (queen bed downstairs and a lovely balcony area - 2 twin beds upstairs for our two teenagers). Bathroom was huge and all marble. Very nice. ( They were doing construction on the room next to us - the balcony area is one huge balcony - sectioned off by little fences - so we were aware of the workmen next door - but we never heard any banging noise and they were basically as unobtrusive as they could have been.They were out there one morning as I sat with my coffee waiting for others to shower - they just smiled and went about their business )- Yes you did have to climb many, many steps to get up there (very tiring when you've been walking all day). We just made sure we had everything we needed when we left in the morning so we only had to make one trip back up - when we returned. Breakfast was fine - breads, cereal, yogurt, juice, coffee. Free access to the internet was a nice bonus - most hotels charge you for internet time. We were able to check our email several times (my daughter could keep in touch with the boyfriend!). People at the front desk were very friendly and helpful. I went directly across the street to a little wine/olive oil shop and was able to taste several oils to choose one to bring home. Overall a great experience - very pleased with the hotel and fell in love with Rome. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: right in the center of rome, very friendly staff. Very much hotel and location for the price. Can warmly recommend the hotel to everybody who goes to rome

Reviews.Title: “We saw 3 rooms,only one was excellent.”
Reviews.Author: expatdallas
Reviews.Content: The 5 Star rating I gave the hotel is based on room 76 in the main building. At first we were given room 52 in the annex, which was large nicely decorated but not recently renovated. I guess they gave us this room as we have a toddler and there is an elevator. But there was a small bathroom with no bath and the first morning we tried to give our little girl a shower she screamed her heart out! The room was also very noisey. I requested a room with a bath and they showed us room 51 in the annex, same ok decor but a smaller room, nice wooden ceiling but kind of dark and dull. Neither room had a balcony or terrece. I asked if I had to trade down in size for a bath and then they showed me room 76 on the 4th floor in the main building and I jumped on it. It is a far superior room - newly renovated with a large marble batroom, double shower head, full length windows and iron railings overlooking a pretty courtyard, much brighter (although still no patio or terrace - they were across the hall). For us it was worth the climb even with a toddler (there is an elevator in the main building but I guess it's just a service elevator). My husband could not believe they charge the same price for the rooms. The rooms we saw in the annex I would have rated around Average. As for the other rooms in the main building - it looks like some corriders have renovated rooms and some don't. I noticed from other reviews that somebody paid for a superior room and was given room 51 and thought they had just been given the first available room. Based on that I would not reccomend paying more. As everybody has stated, the location is great and Rome is a delight. The Pizzaria they reccomended neraby was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the San Carlo in Rome for three nights in April and then two more nights in May. We loved it. Our room in April was the top, top, floor. A LONG stair climb but the private balcony and roof top patio provided a welcome retreat after a day of crowded sightseeing. The room itself (it's the only one on the top, top floor) was ok. I could even do a little sunbathing, which was very relaxing. Nothing fancy, but certainly clean & comfortable. We came back for a few nights in May, and this time in a regular room. We were pleasantly surprised to find that the room itself was very modern (much nicer than our earlier room), and the bathroom was awesome! We also had a balcony, but much smaller. The staff was super helpful to us. Breakfast was your average european breakfast of pastries & jam, better than nothing. Also, there are grocery stores nearby. We had a fridge in the room on the top, top floor and basically made our own light breakfast every morning. The location is PERFECT. Two blocks from the Spanish steps, right in the middle of major shopping, and ten minutes (on foot) from the Trevi Fountain. All other major attractions (including the Vatican) are nomore than 30 minutes by foot; most are less. Subway is right there, as well. Would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Unpleasant surprises”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I made reservations for 2 rooms at the Hotel San Carlo in early March 2005 for a trip in mid-June. Prior to our arrival I confirmed the reservation first by e-mail and then by phone while in Italy. The latter involved 2 phone calls to the hotel to both confirm the reservation and obtain driving directions as I had indicated to them in March we would be driving to the hotel. They were reluctant to give drivinig directions but ultimately provided very poor directions and acted like they were doing me a favor. However, the worst surprise came when we finally arrived at the hotel when we were notified they did not have our rooms due to overbooking. They did, to their credit, arrange for rooms in the same area, but we really did have any choice in the matter. This was inconvienent especially after traveling 5 hours from the Amalfi Coast. They seemed very cavilear about the situation and I believe they could have handled it better. I should say we very much liked Rome so my comments are not tainted by any other unfortunate experiences. My recommendation is to be very cautious about booking with the Hotel San Carlo; maybe this happends alot but not in my experiences.

Reviews.Title: “San Carlo - ideal!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at San Carlo for 3 nights after a lot of hotel searching and 2 different cancellations on reading the trip advisor reviews!! San Carlo is just perfect. Great location- near the Spanish Steps but in one of the quieter side streets. Plenty to do round about and the room is just your own quiet haven. Just refurbished, it is spotlessly clean, simple and elegant. We stayed in the annex round the corner from the main hotel - its through a secure entrance in a lovely courtyard. We would highly recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My review is very similar to several other recent postings. We booked a room for three (My wife and I and our teenage son) and our room was in the "annex". I'm not sure, but I suspect the annex isn't owned by the San Carlo. I didn't see any markings in the hotel room that indicated it was really the San Carlo, and when I checked out, I settled up in the annex, not at the front desk. The only time we went into the San Carlo was to eat breakfast. However, whoever owns it, the annex was wonderful. The room on the third floor was brand new, and much larger than I expected (two rooms plus a bathroom). It was also spotlessly clean. The air conditioning was cold and the shower was hot. With the windows shut and the air on, it was quiet for sleeping. There was an elevator, but we usually took the stairs. The main room had two twin beds pushed together, a closet, fridge, and TV. It was connected by a short hall to a sitting room containing two chairs and a desk. Both chairs could be converted into beds. The bathroom, which was also good sized, was connected to the sitting room. The annex staff was very nice and very helpful. They sat at a desk in a small landing right outside of our room on the third floor. There was someone at the desk (either a young man or young woman) all the time. They gave us some good restaurant suggestions and made reservations for us. The location is perfect. The area around the hotel is full of high-end retail stores and restaurants. For example, the ground floor of the annex is a Versace store. Its a fun area to wander, day and night, and people-watch. Evenings, particularly on the weekend, the streets are full of people walking, shopping, and socializing. I felt very safe there. The Spanish Steps and Piazza del Popolo are within a few blocks. It's about a 30 min walk to Vatican or Colesseum. For longer trips, the Metro or bus are both easy to use. I wasn't impressed with the breakfast, but it was OK. It's about what one would expect at a Hampton Inn in the States. Coffee, tea, juice, a couple of varieties of cold cereal, bread, etc. No complaints, though. I highly recommend the annex. We would gladly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The San Carlo is a Gem”
Reviews.Author: RandBSilva
Reviews.Content: The Hotel San Carlo, down the block from the Spanish Steps, is a gem in Rome. We were booked in the Annex, in an old building with a quaint wooden elevator that could fit the two of us, with our luggage! Once we arrived, we were taken to a spacious, newly rennovated room with beautiful wood floors, floor-to-ceiling armoire, lovely bedroom set with night-tables, a couch, coffee table, desk and several lamps. The large windows had shudders that could both close out the light and the heat of the day. It was a wonderful location, ideal for all sight seeing and strolling in the neighborhood. Many cafes and restaurants were steps away. The value was excellent and our floor had its own concierge to help make reservations and answer any questions. Continental breakfast was included and free Internet access. This place is a gem and worth every penny. Ask for a room in the annex, and you'll feel like you have a new apartment in Rome, and not just a sterile hotel room. My husband and I can't wait to return. Rhonda & George Silva, Oakland, Calif.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay here again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was a really lovely hotel to stay at - lots of stair climbing but I didn't mind as the room was fresh and clean and had doors that opened to a private area on the roof top. I was sharing with a friend so the room had two single beds and if we couldn't have opened the doors to use the roof top as well, it would have been quite cramped. But we could, and sitting out there in the sun was lovely. It was a little noisy due to some building work being done but that is probably finished now. Reception were friendly and helpful and there was a computer in the breakfast room I could use for emailing. They also did a simple but great breakfast - the best breakfast I had in a hotel in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “centre of action”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: highly recommended ,we stayed for six nights and really enjoye ourselves!! all staff very helpfull and hotel idealy situated for shopping ,eating sightseeing, etc. Will make sure other people hear about this delightful experience, only drawback if you are on the top floor there is no lift at all. All resturants recommended by reception excellent ,loads within five minutes walk.we will be back. Smiling irish eyes

Reviews.Title: “Reviews turned out to be spot-on”
Reviews.Author: EuroCityWeekender
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel San Carlo for three nights towards end May. Had already read all the reviews on-line, so when we booked we asked for a superior room, in a quiet location, in the main building, second floor or higher. We were assured that they had a room which matched this specification. We arrived earlier than expected (as we had arranged for a private car from the Airport, via the Hotel - it cost EU50, was worth every penny, - the driver was Giorgio Valentini who named all the sights for us as he wove in and out of the Roman traffic!), and were made to feel very welcome. We could leave the bags and they would take them up to our room or, if we preferred, we could leave our bags and come back in an hour when the room would be ready. We came back in an hour, and were shown straight to our room - which was EXACTLY what we had requested. It was room no. 20 on the 2nd floor - a room with a double bed, an en-suite bathroom, and an adjoining single room. Obviously recently renovated, with all marble floors and nice furnishings. Replacement french windows (which closed beautifully and shut out what little noise there was) opened onto an oblique view of a courtyard - we did feel we had swapped a view for night-time quietness, but decided being away from any Vespa noise at night would guarantee a good night's sleep, and this is exactly what we got. Some slight noise from nearby main marble staircase, but not after 11 p.m. or before 7.30 a.m. Good breakfasts. Overall, delighted with our stay. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: JMB
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the San Carlo Roma for 6 nights in May, 2005. We were originally booked in for three nights, but our other plans fell through. When I called to see if they had a room for an extra three nights they were very accomodating, and very welcoming when we got there. The best thing about the San Carlo is the location. We walked everywhere that we wanted to go. The farthest point for us was the Vatican, and that took us less than 20 minutes to get to at a very slow sightseeing pace. It seems like it is in a very busy spot being so close to the Spanish Steps, but the two minute walk to the hotel takes one to a shady, quiet street. There are a number of nice cafes in the immediate vicinity of the hotel, so it is easy to take a little stroll and sit in the sun with your coffee or wine. Our room was a good size and very clean, overlooking a small courtyard. We were on the fourth floor, but I didn't find the walk up the stairs too bad, even after walking around Rome all day. We had a wonderful time in Rome and a great stay at the San Carlo Roma. We would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel San Carlo”
Reviews.Author: Dominicvail
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a trip to Italy that included a two night stay at the Hotel San Carlo. We loved our room (room 54). We were in the annex building around the corner and had a king size bed. The room was massive even by European standards. The people running the place were also great. Breakfast was in the main hotel building and was awesome. The hotel is nicely located a block or so from the Spanish steps in the heart of the shopping and dining district. We walked everywhere from here including Vatican City. I also recommend a visit to the wine bar (can't remember name) just up the street (the sign says "Wine Bar"). I will stay here again on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week at the San Carlo Hotel. The location is unique, close to Spanish Square and Via Condotti. The hotel has been recently renovated, our room at the second floor was new, large, bright and with refined furnishings. The renovations should have been completed, we didn't see any work in progress. The staff was kind and helpuful. We will definetly return there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 5 total nights in mid-March 2005. We originally planned to stay here for our first three nights, then go to Venice for 2, followed by 2 more nights in another Rome hotel. However, we liked this hotel so much we decided to return to it prior to leaving Italy. The best part about the hotel was its location - smack dab in the middle of it all in Piazza di Spagna. You can walk to Piazza Navona, the Pantheon, Trevi Fountain, even ancient Rome. Tons of restaurants and shopping very close by. The hotel itself was great with one caveat - it's currently undergoing renovations. On the plus side, our room and all the common areas are brand new - large bathroom, adequately sized room with all new furniture, refrigerator with complimentary bottled water refreshed daily, and a great breakfast area. However, the completed rooms are on the top floors - we were on the fourth floor - a pretty long climb after a day of sightseeing. Also, the construction work started around 9am, and it wasn't exactly quiet. The staff is great - stamped and mailed all of our postcards, offered to iron our clothes, provided the use of their computer for internet access, etc. Overall, a great value for the 145 Euros we paid (make sure to bring proof of your quoted reservation price if you go through Orbitz, Expedia, etc.). We would definitely stay here again, even despite the renovations. If it wasn't undergoing renovations it would get a full five stars. Great staff, good room, great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: MBColeman
Reviews.Content: The only thing keeping me from giving the hotel an 'excellent' rating was the fact that there is no elevator in the main hotel. After a whole day of sightseeing, climbing 3 flights of stairs is not something I looked forward to. I understand that there is one in the annex. Staff is friendly and helpful. Everything is in walking distance. There is a metro stop (line A) up near Spanish Steps which is just around the corner. That line will take you near Vatican City and to Termini Station (in opposite directions). A nice little restaurant is just across the street and very handy for those days when you have been on your feet all around Rome and really don't want to go far for dinner. Our room was spacious with a very big marble bathroom. It had a tub with a hand held shower. Our room faced the back and was very quiet. Our travel companion had a room facing the side street and noticed very little noise. Both rooms were very comfortable. Continental breakfast offered the best croissonts we've ever tasted, cereal, real juice (not colored water) and yogurt. Would return here with no hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “great location, friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What can I say to add to the praises for this hotel? Well we stayed here for 3 nights arriving at 1am and greated by a really nice elderly porter who showed us to our room. We stayed in the part of the hotel that is accross the street from the main hotel itself, on the 4th floor (glad for the lift to the 3rd floor) then up a small flight of steps to our room No.56. A nice decent sized room with a balcony simply furnished with double bed 2 chairs wardrobe, tv (mabe only 2 English speaking channels but I didn't come to watch it), large washroom only a shower though but a big one. I noticed the airconditioning but didn't need it in late Feb. The location of this hotel is the best, easily in walking distance of the spanish steps, trevi fountain, panthelon. My wife was most impressed that the parallel street 'via dei Condotti' has all the top designer fashion shops on it and all the best dressed people in Rome shop there. Breakfast is a simple continental one but with a strong cafe latte, that is all you need as you will be walking around briskly seeing all the woderful sights. The staff here are very helpful, and always very friendly, I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a great location and doesn't want to break the bank for a clean chearful hotel. One thing I must mention is that you will not need to use any extra transport to get around if you stay here as, everything is in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money at Hotel San Carlo”
Reviews.Author: Laren
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Hotel San Carlo for 5 nights in November 2004. Based on past experience of single rooms in hotels in Europe, I was tempted to stay somewhere that I could get a double room for the same sort of price, but decided to stay here based on the TripAdvisor reviews and the great location of the hotel, and booked a single room. As it turned out, the room I was given was very spacious, with a double (or queen size) bed and a single bed. I didn't find the room noisy (and my room was facing the street), especially with the windows closed (the room had individually controlled air conditioning). The bathroom wasn't the most convenient - the shower (over the bath) was not enclosed in any way, and no shower curtain, so I got water all over the place when I took a shower - but both the bathroom and the rest of the room were very clean. Breakfast was simple but good (I didn't have trouble with the breakfast area being too busy (maybe because I'm not an early riser! or just a less busy time of year perhaps). The location is great, within a couple of minutes' walk of the Spanish Steps and not far from the Trevi Fountain. I used the metro to get around to other places, the Piazza di Spagna metro station is just by the Spanish Steps, so also just a couple of minutes' walk from the hotel. The hotel staff were all very pleasant and friendly. Overall I think this hotel is good value for money - sure, it's not luxurious, but if that's what you want (especially in such a convenient location), you'd have to pay far more.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: ipobeans
Reviews.Content: I would stay here again. Was here during US Thanks giving and paid 100 Euros a night. We got room 59 and it was good, lots of stairs, but its worth it (private rooftop and all that). The shower isn;t something to rave about in fact it was a bit moldy. But location location location. I knew I was going for location while keeping cost low, so my expectations were a bit low even though it was rank 25 out of 800 hotels

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: NJTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in November 04. Compared to our first hotel in Rome, we were so happy to have booked this one to end our trip. Unlike another reviewer on this site that stayed on the second floor, we had a very clean and newly renovated room on the top floor. I think we paid 125 Euro per night, which may help explain the smaller, 100 Euro room of the unsatisfied reviewer. We did have to climb 80 or so steps to get there, but that gave us a terrace with a table and chairs, and a nice view of a church dome and the many plants on the terraces of the apartments across the street. A very hard working man carried our bags up (and down when we left) to the room. I was so impressed with how hard he worked I must have not noticed he smelled. When asked, he told us where the local markets were so we could get some food and drinks for the room. Our queen mattress was firm, the floors polished white marble, the walls bright white with brass lights, the glasses were clean and the fridge had bottles of cold water. The bathroom was small, (same as the others we had in Italy), but clean. It could have used a shelf, but otherwise it was fine. The cab to the airport (ours was a VW van) was 45 Euro. We had also been quoted 40 initially, which meant the driver got a smaller tip. We spent all our Euros keeping only enough for the ride. His bad luck. We loved the location and if we are lucky enough to go to Rome again, we will be trying to book the same room. And yes, if you stay in a big tourist area like this, it can be noisy. What little noise reached our room just reminded us of the wonderful life down on the street as we drifted off to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am glad I did not read the previous review before going to Rome! The hotel was everything all the other reviewers promised: centrally located, tasteful, immaculately clean, with friendly staff. The room was not huge, but more spacious than the room we just had in Amsterdam, for instance. New furniture, newly renovated bathroom, excellent windows that shield you from the street noise. Will visit it again when in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in Rome”
Reviews.Author: dewatobay
Reviews.Content: Given the location, their rooms, some with bathtubs, and the accommodating, generous staff; this Hotel is the BEST VALUE in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Hotel San Carlo”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Thanks to all of you who provided comments on Rome Hotels in the last few months. We chose the Hotel San Carlo and were not disappointed. Your descriptions of the hotel were very accurate. We spent six nights here in two different rooms in the annex. They were roomy by European standards and comfortable. The showers though, were small and in Room 57 the shower was over the bath and required some agility to manage safely. You had prepared us for the crowded breakfast room and that was not a problem for us. The people at reception were very helpful. But in spite of your warnings we were ripped off by the taxi driver who took us from the Termini to the Hotel. If you are new to Rome it is very difficult to tell the difference between licensed and unlicensed taxis. My E20 bill became an E5 one in nano seconds and the driver also refused to take us right to the hotel and dropped us at the Spanish Steps. Thanks for warning us about that, too. We would strongly advise that you get the Hotel to organise a taxi to pick you up from the airport. It will cost around E45.00. If you have to use taxis in Rome, pay in E5 bills because they cannot be changed for anything smaller and count them out one at a time!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel San Carlo - pleasant, clean, and quiet”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved Rome and Hotel San Carlo. It is tucked away on a quiet street just minutes away from the Spanish Steps. Ideal location! Great restaurants close by. We had room 78 with our own private terrace - lovely. Room was recently updated with very nice bathroom. Staff was helpful. Just an overall nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price, highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful! The location was excellent, less than 5 minutes walk to the Spanish Steps and 10 minutes to Trevi Fountain. We picked this hotel based on the great reviews from Tripadvisor. We stayed at the main building (accommodation 1) and the stairs weren't so bad. The room was beautiful, newly renovated, clean, high ceiling, comfortable bed, great air-con and has a large bathroom. It was even better than we expected. The staff were very nice and helpful (especially Rosanna). We were very happy with our stay. I highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at this hotel in June 2004. The location is perfect - easy walk to the Spanish Steps, Vatican City, Piazza Navona, and the Pantheon . . . a longer hike to the Colloseum. The hotel was extremely clean, the staff was accomodating and helpful, and the rooms were really large. We had a Double Superior and since we were travelling with our baby, they actually gave us a room with 2 separate bedrooms! They did the same for another family traveling with us. Another party traveling with us (who had stayed in Rome several times before) actually booked this hotel again for later in their trip. When I get the good fortune to go back, I'll be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: late July 2004: We can't say anything bad about this hotel, because everything went beyond our expectations. The location could not get any better, we walked everywhere, the Colosseum was the farthest at 30 minutes but you're in Rome, you can't take the subway! The room was excellent, we have stayed in 5 star hotels and this room was better (honestly). The breakfast was also excellent for being included in the price. And the price was 130 euros-extremely good value for Rome and what the hotel offered. Our good memories have convinced us to stay at this hotel when we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, no problems”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights in July. The rooms are well decorated and clean. Something you might expect from a Marriott Hotel. The rooms are not as big but adequate. Typical for Europe. AC worked very well. Breakfast was a like most American hotels that offer free breakfast. Small offering but adequate-coffee, juice, yogurt, croissant, whole fruit. If you have problems walking flights of stairs you should get a room on a lower floor. We were on the top floor and it is a bit of a breather even at 40 and in desent shape. Location was wonderful. Three blocks from the spainish steps and subway. Safe location.

Reviews.Title: “An absolute gem”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were very surprised and very pleased with our room. It was very spacious and high ceiling. The floor was tile which made it cool. The bathroom was spacious. The location was great - we walked everywhere. We are just a minute's walk to the Spanish Step and Via Del Corse. We were able to return to our room many times during the day. The metro station is nearby along with many small restuarants. The bed was firm and the room was nicely decorated. The staff were friendly and helpful. It's a bargain and breakfast is included. I would definitely stay here again and again.

Reviews.Title: “we will be back”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My friends have been staying in "San Carlo" for years. Now we know why. The hotel is a little gem in the very center of Rome. Great!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - very helpful staff - everything within walking distance.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hotel San Carlo is in a great location on a quiet ( for the area) side street. The staff are very helpful in all areas ( taxi's, restaurants, etc..). The hotel is only 5 minutes from the Spanish Steps and you can walk to the Vatican in 20 minutes. The rooms are very clean and there is great a/c. If you book a room and do not want to climb stairs, you should not request any rooms at the top. There are no elevator's to go up to the top floors. All in all for the area and the hotel itself, this is a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Everzthing zou could want in a Rome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We love the San Carlo. It is in the center of all the great things to see and do in Rome. There are plenty of great restaurants nearby and the staff helps you find the best of these. The rooms are very comfortable, even in the annex where we spent a few nights. They offer everything that you need. We reccommend it to all of our friends and they have all loved it too.

Reviews.Title: “The San Carlo made a great trip perfect”
Reviews.Author: llmccauley
Reviews.Content: Wanting a hotel with a central location in Rome, we chose the San Carlo, near the foot of the Spanish Steps. We were greeted cheerfully--by name!--when we arrived, and we climbed the 80 steps to our room (this may be a problem for others). We absolutely loved the hotel. Our room was small by American standards, but lovely and clean (#78), and we enjoyed using a section of the balcony that they partitioned off for us. We had read that the breakfast area would be crowded, so we ordered in our room the first 2 mornings. However, we decided to eat downstairs the last two mornings, and we enjoyed meeting others who were staying there (and we had no trouble getting a table). Visit Rome in May! The weather was absolutely perfect--cool but not cold, and flowers were everywhere. We enjoyed bus tours to Tivoli and the Catacombs, which were outside the city. The hotel staff made all the arrangements for us. Otherwise, we walked or took the subway everywhere. The San Carlo is situated so well that we were able to stop by the room to drop off bags, clean up, etc. We learned to keep our hands in our pockets on the subway (my husband was pickpocketed out of his front pants pocket!) and count out our bills to taxi drivers. After a long ride to the airport, I handed the driver two 50-euro bills. He switched one with a ten and laid them on the seat beside me as if to say, "This isn't enough." I was tired and flustered, so I didn't realize what he did until I later realized that I hadn't had any 10-euro bills. . . . An expensive lesson--please learn from my mistake to count out your bills to people when paying! The vacation was all I hoped it would be, and we would definitely stay at the San Carlo again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Fine hotel - the room (in the main building, no 35) was clean and the furniture acceptable. It was a pity that our request for a room in the annex had not reached the hotel (or was ignored?), so we did not have a balcony. Nevertheless, the staff was friendly and helpful. Minusses were the towels (with huge holes in it) and the breakfast. Still four stars to me, because of the perfect location, and because I had not expected such clean, fine rooms for EUR 160 per night in a city like Rome.
